original: grangs can gyi phyogs ni sngar mdzod kyi gnas gsum par bkag zin to //
analyzed: grangs can gyi phyogs ni sngar mdzod kyi gnas gsum par bkag zin to //
translated: The SƒÅ·πÉkhya position was already refuted in the third chapter of the Treasury of Abhidharma.

original: gnyis pa'i yang zhes bya ba ni btsun pa dbyangs sgrogs kyi'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa'i yang zhes bya ba ni btsun pa dbyangs sgrogs kyi'o //
translated: The second is that of Bhadanta Gho·π£aka.

original: dus 'chol bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni gang zhig 'das pa'i dus su ma 'ongs par 'dod pa de ni ma 'ongs par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dus 'chol bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni gang zhig 'das pa'i dus su ma 'ongs par 'dod pa de ni ma 'ongs par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: There would be a disorder of time periods because that which is asserted to be future in the past would also be future in the present.

original: ji ltar zhe na /üîΩ'das pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan la /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na / 'das pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan la /
translated: How so?üîΩIt would not be that which possesses the characteristics of the past

original: ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar ba'i mtshan nyid dag dang mi ldan pa ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar ba'i mtshan nyid dag dang mi ldan pa ma yin pa ste /

original: ldan zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ldan zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It would possess those characteristics.

original: ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba yang de dang 'dra bar brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba yang de dang 'dra bar brjod par bya ste /
translated: The future and present should be described in the same way.

original: re re yang dus gsum dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: re re yang dus gsum dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because each would possess the three times.

original: skyes bu zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: skyes bu zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: The person would be eternal.

original: skyes bu bud med kyi gong bu gzhan la 'dod chags kun du 'byung zhing shas che ba ni bud med la chags pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: skyes bu bud med kyi gong bu gzhan la 'dod chags kun du 'byung zhing shas che ba ni bud med la chags pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Attachment to women is the excessive and repeated occurrence of attachment to the body of a woman or man who is another‚Äôs wife.

original: ldan pa'i sgo nas ni 'dod chags dang bral ba zhes bya na /üîΩchos la ni mtshan nyid @114a * //
analyzed: ldan pa'i sgo nas ni 'dod chags dang bral ba zhes bya na / chos la ni mtshan nyid @114a * //
translated: One is said to be free from attachment through the possession of the antidote.

original: kun du 'byung ba 'am mtshan nyid dang mi ldan pa med de /
analyzed: kun du 'byung ba 'am mtshan nyid dang mi ldan pa med de /
translated: But a phenomenon has no characteristic that occurs or does not occur.

original: chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid dag ni dus rnams su 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid dag ni dus rnams su 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The characteristics of phenomena are not confused in the three times.

original: de'i phyir 'dir dpe la dngos dang mtshungs pa ci zhig yod /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir dpe la dngos dang mtshungs pa ci zhig yod /
translated: Therefore, what is the similarity between the example and the meaning here?

original: bzhi pa'i ste /
analyzed: bzhi pa'i ste /
translated: The Sautrantikas say:

original: btsun pa sangs rgyas lha'i yang dus gcig la snga ma dang phyi ma'i skad cig ma yod de /
analyzed: btsun pa sangs rgyas lha'i yang dus gcig la snga ma dang phyi ma'i skad cig ma yod de /
translated: The Venerable Buddhadeva says: In one moment, the past and future exist.

original: de la snga ma dang phyi ma'i skad cig ma dag ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa yin la /
analyzed: de la snga ma dang phyi ma'i skad cig ma dag ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa yin la /
translated: In that moment, the past and future moments exist.

original: dbus kyi ni da ltar byung ba yin pas 'das pa'i dus la yang dus gsum yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbus kyi ni da ltar byung ba yin pas 'das pa'i dus la yang dus gsum yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since the middle moment is the present, the past has three times.

original: de lta bas na de dag thams cad kyi nang na gsum pa bzang ste zhes bya ba ni bye brag tu smra ba rnams so //
analyzed: de lta bas na de dag thams cad kyi nang na gsum pa bzang ste zhes bya ba ni bye brag tu smra ba rnams so //
translated: the VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas say.

original: ji ltar bzang zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar bzang zhe na /
translated: How is it the best?

original: gang gi phyir de ni bya ba yis /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ni bya ba yis /
translated: Because it is the best

original: dus rnams rnam gzhag ces bya ba smos so //
analyzed: dus rnams rnam gzhag ces bya ba smos so //
translated: in terms of the presentation of the three times.

original: gang gi tshe chos de bya ba mi byed pa de'i tshe ni ma 'ongs pa yin la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: gang gi tshe chos de bya ba mi byed pa de'i tshe ni ma 'ongs pa yin la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ste /
translated: When a phenomenon does not perform its function, it is future.

original: bya ba yang mig la sogs pa rnams kyi ni lta ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba yang mig la sogs pa rnams kyi ni lta ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The function of the eye and so on is seeing.

original: rnam par shes pa'i rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: The function of consciousness is to know.

original: gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyi ni rang gi dbang po'i spyod yul nyid do //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyi ni rang gi dbang po'i spyod yul nyid do //
translated: The function of form and so on is to be the object of the eye and so on.

original: slob dpon gyi de thams cad ni go na zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: slob dpon gyi de thams cad ni go na zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
translated: The Master says, ‚ÄúAll of that is understood.‚Äù

original: gal te 'das pa yang rdzas su yod la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: gal te 'das pa yang rdzas su yod la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: If the past also exists substantially,

original: gal te 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa da ltar ba bzhin du rang gi ngo bo kho nas yod na ni /
analyzed: gal te 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa da ltar ba bzhin du rang gi ngo bo kho nas yod na ni /
translated: If the past and future existed by way of their own entity just like the present,

original: da ltar ba dang khyad par 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin pas de'i 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa nyid nyams par 'gyur ro snyam du dgongs so //
analyzed: da ltar ba dang khyad par 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin pas de'i 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa nyid nyams par 'gyur ro snyam du dgongs so //
translated: then they would not differ in the least from the present, and their status as past and future would be undermined.

original: yod kyang da ltar las khyad par yod par bstan pa'i phyir bya ba yis /
analyzed: yod kyang da ltar las khyad par yod par bstan pa'i phyir bya ba yis /
translated: To show that even though they exist, they do differ from the present, he says,

original: dus rnams rnam gzhag ces bshad pa ma yin nam zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: dus rnams rnam gzhag ces bshad pa ma yin nam zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
translated: ‚ÄúBut it is not explained that the times are posited by action.‚Äù

original: gal te de ltar na da ltar byung ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la mig gi bya ba ni lta ba yin na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar na da ltar byung ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la mig gi bya ba ni lta ba yin na /
translated: If that is so, then in such passages as ‚Äúthat which has arisen in the present,‚ÄùüîΩthe action of the eye is seeing, but since that is not done by that, at that time, the present would become the future.

original: de yang de dang mtshungs par byed pa ma yin pas de'i tshe da ltar ba yang ma 'ongs par 'gyur ba'i phyir bya ba'i dus rnam par gzhag pa mi rigs so zhes bya ba ni dri ba'i bsam pa'o //
analyzed: de yang de dang mtshungs par byed pa ma yin pas de'i tshe da ltar ba yang ma 'ongs par 'gyur ba'i phyir bya ba'i dus rnam par gzhag pa mi rigs so zhes bya ba ni dri ba'i bsam pa'o //
translated: Therefore it is illogical to posit the time of action. This is the thought of the question.

original: 'bras bu 'byin pa dang 'dzin pa yin no zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: 'bras bu 'byin pa dang 'dzin pa yin no zhes bya bas ni /
translated: ‚ÄúIt is the producer and the experiencer of the effect‚Äù

original: 'di skad du /
analyzed: 'di skad du /
translated: This is stated:

original: lta ba la sogs pa'i bya bas ni dus rnam par gzhag pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: lta ba la sogs pa'i bya bas ni dus rnam par gzhag pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Time is not posited by the actions of seeing and so on.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /üîΩ'bras bu 'byin pa dang 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid kyis yin te /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na / 'bras bu 'byin pa dang 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid kyis yin te /
translated: What is it then?

original: 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: It is the state of producing and holding its result because it is nonerroneous.

original: lhan cig 'byung ba'i chos rnams ni de'i skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu @114b yin la /
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba'i chos rnams ni de'i skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu @114b yin la /
translated: Coemergent phenomena are its active result.

original: de ma thag tu 'byung ba'i mig gi dbang po ni skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu dang / rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu de yin zhing /
analyzed: de ma thag tu 'byung ba'i mig gi dbang po ni skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu dang / rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu de yin zhing /
translated: The immediately arising eye faculty is its active result and result of natural outflow.

original: 'bras bu de yang 'byin pa dang 'dzin pa na da ltar ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu de yang 'byin pa dang 'dzin pa na da ltar ba zhes bya'o //
translated: When that result is produced and held, it is called present.

original: 'o na ni skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'o na ni skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Homogeneous cause and so on

original: skal ba mnyam pa dang / kun du 'gro ba dang ; rnam par smin pa'i rgyu rnams so //
analyzed: skal ba mnyam pa dang / kun du 'gro ba dang ; rnam par smin pa'i rgyu rnams so //
translated: Homogeneous, omnipresent, and karmic causes.

original: 'bras bu 'byin pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba la rgyu mthun pa dang / rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu 'byin pa'i phyir bya ba yod par thal bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'bras bu 'byin pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba la rgyu mthun pa dang / rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu 'byin pa'i phyir bya ba yod par thal bar 'gyur la /
translated: Because it produces an effect, it follows that it would have activity.

original: de'i phyir 'das pa yang da ltar ba nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'das pa yang da ltar ba nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And because of that, it follows that the past would be present.

original: bya ba phyed du zhes bya ba la gal te 'bras bu 'byin pa dang 'dzin pa bsdus par bya ba 'dod na /
analyzed: bya ba phyed du zhes bya ba la gal te 'bras bu 'byin pa dang 'dzin pa bsdus par bya ba 'dod na /
translated: If you assert that activity is half,

original: de lta na yang phyed da ltar ba nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na yang phyed da ltar ba nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then even in that case, it follows that half of it would be present.

original: thams cad kyi tshe bya ba byed pa la gegs mi srid do snyam ste /
analyzed: thams cad kyi tshe bya ba byed pa la gegs mi srid do snyam ste /
translated: It is impossible for there to be an obstruction to the performance of activity at all times.

original: 'dri ba ni 'di yang brjod par bya dgos te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dri ba ni 'di yang brjod par bya dgos te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This question must be addressed:

original: de'i bdag nyid kho nar yod na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid kho nar yod na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: If it exists in just that nature,

original: da ltar ba'i rang bzhin de kho nar yod cing bdog na rtag tu bya ba byed pa la gegs su zhig byed de /
analyzed: da ltar ba'i rang bzhin de kho nar yod cing bdog na rtag tu bya ba byed pa la gegs su zhig byed de /
translated: if it exists and is present in just that nature of the present, then what obstructs it from always performing activity?

original: gang gis na res 'ga' zhig bya ba mi byed par 'gyur ba /
analyzed: gang gis na res 'ga' zhig bya ba mi byed par 'gyur ba /
translated: Why would it sometimes not perform its function?

original: su zhig gegs byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: su zhig gegs byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Who is the one that obstructs it?üîΩIf you say that it is because the conditions do not assemble,

original: gal te rkyen rnams ma tshogs pa yin no zhes bya ba la rgyu dang mtshungs pa de ma thag pa la sogs pa rnams ma tshogs pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te rkyen rnams ma tshogs pa yin no zhes bya ba la rgyu dang mtshungs pa de ma thag pa la sogs pa rnams ma tshogs pa yin te /
translated: then the cause, the equivalent immediately preceding condition, and so on do not assemble.

original: de'i phyir thams cad kyi tshe bya ba byed par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir thams cad kyi tshe bya ba byed par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Therefore, it would not perform its function at all times.üîΩBecause you accept that they always exist,

original: rtag tu yod pa nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rgyu la sogs pa'i rkyen de rnams dus thams cad du yod pa nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir rkyen ma tshogs par brtag par mi rigs so //
analyzed: rtag tu yod pa nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rgyu la sogs pa'i rkyen de rnams dus thams cad du yod pa nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir rkyen ma tshogs par brtag par mi rigs so //
translated: because you accept that those conditions such as the cause always exist, it is illogical to imagine that the conditions do not assemble.

original: bya ba 'das pa dang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: bya ba 'das pa dang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: If you say that it is because the action is past,

original: 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: then this is what is taught:

original: gal te bya ba la bya ba gzhan zhig med par yang bya ba yin par 'dod na ni dngos po rnams kyang de ltar ma 'ongs pa la sogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te bya ba la bya ba gzhan zhig med par yang bya ba yin par 'dod na ni dngos po rnams kyang de ltar ma 'ongs pa la sogs par 'gyur te /
translated: If you assert that an action is an action even without another action, then things would be like that, that is, future and so on.

original: bya ba brtag pas ci zhig bya /üîΩji ste 'khrul pa'i skyon du 'gyur du 'ong bas bya ba la yang /
analyzed: bya ba brtag pas ci zhig bya / ji ste 'khrul pa'i skyon du 'gyur du 'ong bas bya ba la yang /
translated: What is the use of analyzing action?

original: bya ba gzhan 'dod na ni de lta na yang thug pa med pas thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bya ba gzhan 'dod na ni de lta na yang thug pa med pas thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But if you assert that an action has another action, then even in that case, the error of infinite regress would ensue.

original: 'on te de ni 'das pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'on te de ni 'das pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: But if you say that it is not past, and so on.

original: de'i tshe ma 'ongs pa yin no zhes brjod par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de'i tshe ma 'ongs pa yin no zhes brjod par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: At that time, you should not say that it is future.

original: de 'dus ma byas yin pa'i phyir thams cad kyi tshe na yod par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de 'dus ma byas yin pa'i phyir thams cad kyi tshe na yod par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Because it is unconditioned, it would follow that it exists at all times.

original: skyon der yang 'gyur @115a * //
analyzed: skyon der yang 'gyur @115a * //
translated: That error would ensue.üîΩBut if you say that it is not present, and so on, then that error would ensue.

original: ba zhig na zhes bya ba ni bya ba la yang bya ba yod par thal ba dang / 'dus ma byas nyid do //
analyzed: ba zhig na zhes bya ba ni bya ba la yang bya ba yod par thal ba dang / 'dus ma byas nyid do //
translated: That is, the error of the infinite regress of action and the error of being unconditioned.

original: gal te chos las bya ba gzhan zhig yin na ni zhes bya ba la /üîΩchos las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir na ni bya ba chos bzhin du 'dus ma byas ma yin la /
analyzed: gal te chos las bya ba gzhan zhig yin na ni zhes bya ba la / chos las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir na ni bya ba chos bzhin du 'dus ma byas ma yin la /
translated: If action were different from the entity, thenüîΩbecause it is not different from the entity, action would not be unconditioned like the entity.

original: chos ltar de la bya ba gzhan yod pa ma yin pas thug pa med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: chos ltar de la bya ba gzhan yod pa ma yin pas thug pa med pa ma yin no //
translated: And because there is no other action in the entity, there is no infinite regress.

original: de lta na ni 'o na /
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na /
translated: If that is so,

original: dus su mi rung ba de nyid du 'gyur te de nyid ni de nyid kyi dus rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyur mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus su mi rung ba de nyid du 'gyur te de nyid ni de nyid kyi dus rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyur mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: then that very thing is not suitable as the cause for positing its time, because it is not suitable as time.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir gal te chos kho na bya ba yin na zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir gal te chos kho na bya ba yin na zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
translated: In order to demonstrate that very point, he says, if action were the entity itself, etc.

original: mi 'grub pa ci zhig yod ces bya ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: mi 'grub pa ci zhig yod ces bya ba 'byung ste /
translated: What is not established?

original: dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo nyid ni dus rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu nyid du mi 'dod de /
analyzed: dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo nyid ni dus rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu nyid du mi 'dod de /
translated: The intrinsic reality of a thing is not asserted as the cause for positing time.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: skyes pa dang ma skyes pa dang zhi ba'i gnas skabs dag tu dus rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu nyid du khas len no //
analyzed: skyes pa dang ma skyes pa dang zhi ba'i gnas skabs dag tu dus rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu nyid du khas len no //
translated: The Sautrantikas accept that time is the cause for the positing of the three times, past, future, and present.

original: de'i tshe yang dus kyi rnam par gzhag pa mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: de'i tshe yang dus kyi rnam par gzhag pa mi 'grub bo //
translated: But even then, the positing of time is not established.

original: ci zhig mi 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ci zhig mi 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba la /
translated: What does not occur?

original: gang zhig ma skyes pas ma skyes pa zhes bya ba gzugs la sogs pa skyes pa ni sngon ma 'ongs pa'i gnas skabs su ci zhig ma byung bar gyur /
analyzed: gang zhig ma skyes pas ma skyes pa zhes bya ba gzugs la sogs pa skyes pa ni sngon ma 'ongs pa'i gnas skabs su ci zhig ma byung bar gyur /
translated: What is not yet arisen is called ‚Äúfuture.‚Äù What is arisen, such as form, etc., what did not occur in the past when it was in the future?

original: bya ba ma byung bar gyur to zhes bya bar 'dod na /
analyzed: bya ba ma byung bar gyur to zhes bya bar 'dod na /
translated: If you accept that the action did not occur,

original: de lta yin na chos kho na ma byung bar gyur to zhes bya bar smras par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin na chos kho na ma byung bar gyur to zhes bya bar smras par 'gyur ro //
translated: then you would be saying that only the phenomenon did not occur.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: chos las bya ba gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos las bya ba gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the action is not different from the phenomenon.

original: gang zhig med pas zhig pa zhes bya ba phyis zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gang zhig med pas zhig pa zhes bya ba phyis zhes bya ba ste /
translated: What is nonexistent is called ‚Äúdestroyed,‚Äù that is, later.

original: 'das pa'i gnas skabs ni ci zhig med /
analyzed: 'das pa'i gnas skabs ni ci zhig med /
translated: What is nonexistent in the past?

original: gal te bya ba med do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te bya ba med do zhe na /
translated: If you say that the action is nonexistent,

original: phyis chos kho na med do zhes smras par 'gyur te /
analyzed: phyis chos kho na med do zhes smras par 'gyur te /
translated: Later, you would say that there is no dharma at all,

original: chos las bya ba gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos las bya ba gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no action other than dharma.

original: gal te ma byung ba la byung ba zhes bya ba mi 'dod phan chad de /
analyzed: gal te ma byung ba la byung ba zhes bya ba mi 'dod phan chad de /
translated: If you do not accept that what has not yet arisen is called arisen,

original: cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: what would be the consequence?

original: da ltar byung ba mi 'grub po //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba mi 'grub po //
translated: The present would not be established.

original: byung nas kyang yang mi 'byung bar mi 'dod phan chad ni 'das pa'i dus mi 'grub po //
analyzed: byung nas kyang yang mi 'byung bar mi 'dod phan chad ni 'das pa'i dus mi 'grub po //
translated: If you do not accept that having arisen it does not arise again, then the past would not be established.

original: ma byung ba las byung ba dang / byung nas kyang ma byung ngo zhes de ltar 'dod na ni dus gsum 'grub ste /
analyzed: ma byung ba las byung ba dang / byung nas kyang ma byung ngo zhes de ltar 'dod na ni dus gsum 'grub ste /
translated: If you accept that what has not yet arisen arises and that having arisen it does not arise again, then the three times are established,

original: gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du ni ma yin no //

original: de dag nyid dus gtam bzhi dang @117a * //üîΩzhes bshad do //
analyzed: de dag nyid dus gtam bzhi dang @117a * // zhes bshad do //
translated: Those four are the four times.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i mig med do zhes bya ba 'di grub pa yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i mig med do zhes bya ba 'di grub pa yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is established that the future eye does not exist.

original: gal te rang gi bdag nyid la ma byung ba las byung ba na ni de lta na mig ma byung ba las byung ngo zhes bya bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: gal te rang gi bdag nyid la ma byung ba las byung ba na ni de lta na mig ma byung ba las byung ngo zhes bya bar 'gyur la /
translated: If it arises from that which has not arisen from its own self, then in that case the future eye would arise from that which has not arisen.

original: de'i phyir ma 'ongs pa'i mig med do zhes bya bar grub pa yin no //üîΩre zhig 'dir zhes bya bar rgyas par 'byung ngo //üîΩmig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa rnams kyi yul da ltar ba yin pa'i phyir rten ltar dmigs pa yang skyed par byed pa nyid yin pas yid kyi rnam par shes pa kho na nye bar bkod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir ma 'ongs pa'i mig med do zhes bya bar grub pa yin no // re zhig 'dir zhes bya bar rgyas par 'byung ngo // mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa rnams kyi yul da ltar ba yin pa'i phyir rten ltar dmigs pa yang skyed par byed pa nyid yin pas yid kyi rnam par shes pa kho na nye bar bkod do //
translated: Therefore it is established that the future eye does not exist.üîΩThe present eye is the support of the visual consciousness,üîΩbut the object of the visual consciousness is present, and thus the object is like the support in that it is the generator of the visual consciousness.

original: yid da ltar ba kho na de'i rkyen nyid du gnas pas skyed par byed pa'i rkyen yin pa ltar chos rnams kyang de dang 'dra 'am /
analyzed: yid da ltar ba kho na de'i rkyen nyid du gnas pas skyed par byed pa'i rkyen yin pa ltar chos rnams kyang de dang 'dra 'am /
translated: The present mental faculty is the dominant condition of the mental consciousness, and thus it is the generating condition of the mental consciousness.üîΩAre phenomena like that?

original: gal te chos rnams skyed par byed pa'i rkyen yin no zhe na ni /üîΩ'o na ma 'ongs pa bskal ba stong na 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa nye ba yang skyed par byed pa'i rkyen du mi 'dod na /
analyzed: gal te chos rnams skyed par byed pa'i rkyen yin no zhe na ni / 'o na ma 'ongs pa bskal ba stong na 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa nye ba yang skyed par byed pa'i rkyen du mi 'dod na /
translated: If phenomena are the generating condition of the mental consciousness,üîΩthen why is it not accepted that the future mental faculty that will arise in a thousand eons is the generating condition of the mental consciousness?

original: shin tu bskal pa lta smos kyang ci dgos snyam du dgongs te /
analyzed: shin tu bskal pa lta smos kyang ci dgos snyam du dgongs te /
translated: Why is it not accepted that the future mental faculty that will arise in a thousand eons is the generating condition of the mental consciousness?

original: 'bras bu snga la rgyu 'phyi'o snyam du rtog pa ni rigs pa dang ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu snga la rgyu 'phyi'o snyam du rtog pa ni rigs pa dang ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not reasonable to think that the effect precedes the cause.

original: gal te med na ji ltar dmigs pa yin zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gal te med na ji ltar dmigs pa yin zhes bya ba la /
translated: If it does not exist, how can it be apprehended?

original: skyed par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ni ma 'ongs pa rdzas su 'dod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: skyed par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ni ma 'ongs pa rdzas su 'dod pa ma yin te /
translated: The future is not asserted to be a substance because it is a producer.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then why?

original: dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir yin na /üîΩyod pa ma yin par brjod du med pa ni dmigs pa'i ngo bor mi rung ngo zhe na /
analyzed: dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir yin na / yod pa ma yin par brjod du med pa ni dmigs pa'i ngo bor mi rung ngo zhe na /
translated: Because it is an object of apprehension.

original: da ni 'dir zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /üîΩkho bo cag ni de ji ltar dmigs pa yin pa de ltar med do zhes ni mi smra'i /üîΩ'o na ci zhe na ji ltar khyed kyis rdzas su btags pa de ltar med do zhes smra'o //
analyzed: da ni 'dir zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste / kho bo cag ni de ji ltar dmigs pa yin pa de ltar med do zhes ni mi smra'i / 'o na ci zhe na ji ltar khyed kyis rdzas su btags pa de ltar med do zhes smra'o //
translated: It is not suitable for that which is said to be nonexistent to be the nature of an object of apprehension.

original: byung bar gyur pa zhes bya ba ni 'das pa'i dmigs pa yin la /
analyzed: byung bar gyur pa zhes bya ba ni 'das pa'i dmigs pa yin la /
translated: Now here, the past is an object of apprehension that has occurred.

original: de ni de ltar yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: de ni de ltar yod pa nyid do //
translated: It exists in that way.

original: 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa'i dmigs pa yin la /
analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa'i dmigs pa yin la /
translated: The future is an object of apprehension that will occur.

original: de yang de ltar yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: de yang de ltar yod pa nyid do //
translated: and it exists in that way.üîΩBut it is not that they are apprehended as existent in that way, as having occurred or as occurring.

original: byung bar gyur pa dang 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes de dag dmigs kyis yod pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ji ltar shes she na /
analyzed: byung bar gyur pa dang 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes de dag dmigs kyis yod pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ji ltar shes she na /
translated: How do you know that?üîΩTherefore it is said:

original: de'i phyir 'das pa'i gzugs sam zhes bya ba rgyas par smos shing /üîΩmig gi rnam par shes pa dang / nyams su myong ba'i shes pa'i stobs kyis gzugs de ji ltar mthong ba dang / tshor ba ji ltar nyams su myong ba de ltar byung bar gyur to zhes de ltar dran par 'gyur gyi ji ltar mig dang rna ba dang sna dang lce dang lus kyi rnam par shes pa rnams kyis /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'das pa'i gzugs sam zhes bya ba rgyas par smos shing / mig gi rnam par shes pa dang / nyams su myong ba'i shes pa'i stobs kyis gzugs de ji ltar mthong ba dang / tshor ba ji ltar nyams su myong ba de ltar byung bar gyur to zhes de ltar dran par 'gyur gyi ji ltar mig dang rna ba dang sna dang lce dang lus kyi rnam par shes pa rnams kyis /
translated: ‚ÄúPast form‚Äù and so on.üîΩYou remember past form and so on by the power of eye consciousness and the consciousness that experiences feeling, thinking, ‚ÄúI saw such and such form and I experienced such and such feeling.‚Äù

original: gzugs la sogs pa da @117b ltar ba nyams su myong ba de ltar 'das pa dran no zhes 'di nyid la gtan tshigs lhag smos te /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa da @117b ltar ba nyams su myong ba de ltar 'das pa dran no zhes 'di nyid la gtan tshigs lhag smos te /
translated: You do not remember past form and so on by the power of eye consciousness and so on, thinking, ‚ÄúI saw such and such form and I experienced such and such feeling.‚ÄùüîΩThis is a redundant reason.

original: de ni ji ltar nyams su myong ba bzhin de'i bdag nyid du 'das pa yin pas byung bar gyur to zhes 'dzin la /
analyzed: de ni ji ltar nyams su myong ba bzhin de'i bdag nyid du 'das pa yin pas byung bar gyur to zhes 'dzin la /
translated: Since it is the nature of the past as it was experienced, it is apprehended as having occurred.

original: nyams su myong ba dang mthun par dran no //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba dang mthun par dran no //
translated: It is remembered in accordance with the experience.

original: ma 'ongs pa ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: How is the future apprehended?

original: de ltar sangs rgyas rnams kyis mkhyen te thams cad la ye shes thogs pa mi mnga' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar sangs rgyas rnams kyis mkhyen te thams cad la ye shes thogs pa mi mnga' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The Buddhas know it in this way, because their knowledge is unobstructed with regard to everything.

original: gzhan gyis ni ma yin te gzhan gyis ni 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de ltar 'dzin gyi ji ltar da ltar 'gyur ba ltar ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyis ni ma yin te gzhan gyis ni 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de ltar 'dzin gyi ji ltar da ltar 'gyur ba ltar ni ma yin no //
translated: Others do not, because they apprehend the future in this way: ‚ÄúIt will occur,‚Äù but not as it will be in the present.

original: gal te gang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa ji ltar nyams su myong ba dang / ji ltar 'byung bar 'gyur ba de kho na bzhin du yod na ni da ltar du 'gyur gyi 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te gang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa ji ltar nyams su myong ba dang / ji ltar 'byung bar 'gyur ba de kho na bzhin du yod na ni da ltar du 'gyur gyi 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: If the past and future existed as they are experienced and will occur, they would be present, not past or future.

original: da ltar ba dang khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: da ltar ba dang khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they would not differ from the present.

original: 'on te ji ltar nyams su myong ba dang / ji ltar 'byung bar 'gyur ba de ltar med na ni de ltar na btang ba dang blangs pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i ngo bo ni med pa yin pas med pa dmigs pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di grub pa yin no
analyzed: 'on te ji ltar nyams su myong ba dang / ji ltar 'byung bar 'gyur ba de ltar med na ni de ltar na btang ba dang blangs pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i ngo bo ni med pa yin pas med pa dmigs pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di grub pa yin no
translated: But if they do not exist in the way they are experienced and in the way they will occur, then since they would have the nature of being relinquished and taken up, the entity of the past and future would not exist. Therefore it is established that the nonexistent is apprehended.

original: // gal te de nyid sil bu ni de yin no zhes bya ba ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang sbyar te /
analyzed: // gal te de nyid sil bu ni de yin no zhes bya ba ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang sbyar te /
translated: If you say that the past and future are just the present,üîΩthen the past and future would not exist.

original: da ltar ba gang yin pa de nyid sil bu ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa yin no zhe na ma yin te sil bur mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: da ltar ba gang yin pa de nyid sil bu ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa yin no zhe na ma yin te sil bur mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If you say that the present itself is the past and future, then the past and future would not exist because the present is not apprehended as past and future.

original: gal te de dag sil bu yin par gyur na ni sil bu nyid du 'dzin pa 'am /üîΩdran par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gal te de dag sil bu yin par gyur na ni sil bu nyid du 'dzin pa 'am / dran par 'gyur gyi /
translated: If the past and future were discrete, they would be apprehended as discrete.üîΩBut they are not remembered as discrete.

original: da ltar nyams su myong ba ltar byung bar gyur to zhes gong bur gyur pa dran par mi 'gyur ba zhig go //
analyzed: da ltar nyams su myong ba ltar byung bar gyur to zhes gong bur gyur pa dran par mi 'gyur ba zhig go //
translated: They are remembered as a mass, as if they were experienced in the present.

original: gal te yang de ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: gal te yang de ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: If you say that the past and future are form,üîΩbut when the subtle particles disperse,

original: gal te 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa de dag gzugs yin mod kyi de rdul phra rab tu gyes pa na 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa zhes brjod pa 'ba' zhig tu zad kyi /
analyzed: gal te 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa de dag gzugs yin mod kyi de rdul phra rab tu gyes pa na 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa zhes brjod pa 'ba' zhig tu zad kyi /
translated: only the terms past and future remain,

original: chos 'ga' zhig skye ba'am 'jig pa'i phyir ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: chos 'ga' zhig skye ba'am 'jig pa'i phyir ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: and no dharma is produced or destroyed,

original: de lta yin na ni rdul phra rab rnams dus gsum du yang rnam par mi 'gyur ba'i rang gi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir rtag par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de lta yin na ni rdul phra rab rnams dus gsum du yang rnam par mi 'gyur ba'i rang gi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir rtag par 'gyur la /
translated: then the subtle particles would be permanent, because their intrinsic nature would not change in the three times.

original: rdul phra rab bsags pa dang gyes pa tsam du yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: rdul phra rab bsags pa dang gyes pa tsam du yang 'gyur te /
translated: And they would be mere collections and dispersions of subtle particles.

original: da ltar byung ba'i gnas skabs na rdul phra rab bsags pa gang yin pa de bya ba tsam zhig 'das pa dang ma 'ongs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i gnas skabs na rdul phra rab bsags pa gang yin pa de bya ba tsam zhig 'das pa dang ma 'ongs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Whatever is a collection of subtle particles in the present would be mere action in the past and future.

original: de ltar na rdul phra rab rnams rtag par 'gyur zhing rdul phra rab rnams bsags pa tsam nyid da ltar yin pas cung @118a * //
analyzed: de ltar na rdul phra rab rnams rtag par 'gyur zhing rdul phra rab rnams bsags pa tsam nyid da ltar yin pas cung @118a * //
translated: Thus the subtle particles would be permanent, and the present would be mere collections of subtle particles.

original: zad kyang skye ba yang med la de rnams gyes pa tsam zhig 'das pa yin pas cung zad kyang 'gag pa med do //
analyzed: zad kyang skye ba yang med la de rnams gyes pa tsam zhig 'das pa yin pas cung zad kyang 'gag pa med do //
translated: and they do not arise again. Since they are merely dispersed, they do not cease in the least.

original: de ltar na yang 'tsho byed kyi rtsod pa blangs pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na yang 'tsho byed kyi rtsod pa blangs pa yin te /
translated: But this is to take up the argument of Jivaka

original: de dag kyang de skad smra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag kyang de skad smra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because he also says this.üîΩThe sutra would be rejected

original: mdo yang bor bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni 'gal bar byas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mdo yang bor bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni 'gal bar byas par 'gyur ro //
translated: means that it would be contradicted.

original: ji ltar 'gal bar byas par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'gal bar byas par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How would it be contradicted?üîΩThe sutra states:

original: mig ni skye ba na zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: mig ni skye ba na zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ste /
translated: When the eye arises, it does not come from anywhere.üîΩThis contradicts the statement:

original: mig gi dbang po'i rdul phra rab ma 'ongs pa'i dus na sil bu yin pa rnams da ltar byung ba'i dus su bsags par 'gyur ro zhes bya bas ni mig ni skye ba na gang nas kyang mi 'ong ngo zhes bya ba 'di la gnod par 'gyur ro
analyzed: mig gi dbang po'i rdul phra rab ma 'ongs pa'i dus na sil bu yin pa rnams da ltar byung ba'i dus su bsags par 'gyur ro zhes bya bas ni mig ni skye ba na gang nas kyang mi 'ong ngo zhes bya ba 'di la gnod par 'gyur ro
translated: When the eye sense faculty‚Äôs subtle particles are discrete in the future, they will be aggregated in the present.

original: // de bzhin du mig gi dbang po'i rdul phra rab bsags pa rnams bye ba tsam du khas blangs pa'i phyir 'gag pa na yang gang du yang sogs par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di dang 'gal bar byas pa yin no //
analyzed: // de bzhin du mig gi dbang po'i rdul phra rab bsags pa rnams bye ba tsam du khas blangs pa'i phyir 'gag pa na yang gang du yang sogs par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di dang 'gal bar byas pa yin no //
translated: Likewise, since the collection of subtle particles of the eye faculty is accepted as being just a hundred thousand, when it ceases, it does not accumulate anywhere.

original: rdul phra rab bsags pa ma yin pa rnams kyang zhes bya ba ni rdul phra rab rnams kyis ma bsags pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rdul phra rab bsags pa ma yin pa rnams kyang zhes bya ba ni rdul phra rab rnams kyis ma bsags pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Those that are not a collection of subtle particles means those that are not collected by subtle particles.

original: ji ltar na sil bu nyid ces bya ba ni yul na mi gnas pa'i phyir sil bu nyid yod pa ma yin no zhes dgongs so //
analyzed: ji ltar na sil bu nyid ces bya ba ni yul na mi gnas pa'i phyir sil bu nyid yod pa ma yin no zhes dgongs so //
translated: How can they be discrete? He means that they do not exist as discrete because they do not exist in a place.

original: de dag kyang zhes bya ba ni tshor ba la sogs pa dag ste /
analyzed: de dag kyang zhes bya ba ni tshor ba la sogs pa dag ste /
translated: Those also means feelings and so on.

original: ji ltar 'byung zhing nyams su myong ba dran no //
analyzed: ji ltar 'byung zhing nyams su myong ba dran no //
translated: They are remembered as they arise and are experienced.

original: skye mched bcu gsum pa yang dmigs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: skye mched bcu gsum pa yang dmigs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
translated: The thirteenth sense base would be observed.

original: gal te med pa yang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa yin na ni de lta na skye mched bcu gsum pa yang med pas 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa ltar de yang dmigs par 'gyur na dmigs pa de yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te med pa yang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa yin na ni de lta na skye mched bcu gsum pa yang med pas 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa ltar de yang dmigs par 'gyur na dmigs pa de yang ma yin te /
translated: If the non-existent were also the object of mental consciousness, then the thirteenth sense sphere would also be non-existent, and like the past and future, it would be an object. But it is not an object,

original: de'i phyir med pa la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa med do zhes bya bar nges so //
analyzed: de'i phyir med pa la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa med do zhes bya bar nges so //
translated: therefore it is certain that there is no consciousness that has a non-existent as its object.

original: 'o na skye mched bcu gsum pa med do snyam pa'i zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'o na skye mched bcu gsum pa med do snyam pa'i zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: But if one thinks that the thirteenth sense sphere does not exist, etc.

original: skye mched bcu gsum pa med do snyam pa'i shes pa'i dmigs pa ni dngos po yin par mi rung ste /
analyzed: skye mched bcu gsum pa med do snyam pa'i shes pa'i dmigs pa ni dngos po yin par mi rung ste /
translated: The object of the consciousness that thinks that the thirteenth sense sphere does not exist cannot be a real entity,

original: mig la sogs pa bzhin du skye mched bcu gsum pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa bzhin du skye mched bcu gsum pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the thirteenth sense sphere does not exist, like the eye sense faculty, etc.

original: de'i phyir 'di'i dmigs pa ni dngos po med pa las ma gtogs pa gang zhig yod pa brjod par bya dgos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di'i dmigs pa ni dngos po med pa las ma gtogs pa gang zhig yod pa brjod par bya dgos so //
translated: Therefore, it must be said that its object is only a non-existent.

original: bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyis ming de nyid dmigs pa yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyis ming de nyid dmigs pa yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Vaibhasikas say: That very name is the object.

original: bcu gsum pa zhes grangs kyi ming gang yin de nyid dmigs pa yin te /
analyzed: bcu gsum pa zhes grangs kyi ming gang yin de nyid dmigs pa yin te /
translated: The name that is the number thirteen is the object.

original: de'i phyir 'di yang yod pa la dmigs @118b pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di yang yod pa la dmigs @118b pa yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, this also focuses on an existent object.

original: de lta na ni 'o na ming nyid med do zhes bya bar rtog par 'gyur gyi brjod bya skye mched ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na ming nyid med do zhes bya bar rtog par 'gyur gyi brjod bya skye mched ni ma yin no //
translated: If that is so, then it would be conceived that name itself does not exist, but it would not be conceived that the object expressed does not exist.üîΩMoreover, what is the object of the apprehension of the nonexistence of sound prior to its production?

original: gzhan yang sgra'i snga na med pa la dmigs pa ni de'i dmigs pa yang ci zhig yin zhes bya ba ni skye ba bkag pa las ma gtogs pa sgra'i mi skye ba gzhan med do snyam du dgongs so //
analyzed: gzhan yang sgra'i snga na med pa la dmigs pa ni de'i dmigs pa yang ci zhig yin zhes bya ba ni skye ba bkag pa las ma gtogs pa sgra'i mi skye ba gzhan med do snyam du dgongs so //
translated: The meaning is that apart from the negation of production, there is no other nonproduction of sound.üîΩSound itself is the object.

original: sgra kho na yin no zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar te /
analyzed: sgra kho na yin no zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar te /
translated: This is supplied from the context.

original: dus gsum du sgra'i rang gi ngo bo khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus gsum du sgra'i rang gi ngo bo khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the nature of sound is not differentiated in the three times.

original: de lta na ni 'o na ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: If that is so, then it would be conceived that sound itself does not exist.

original: gal te sgra 'i snga na med pa la dmigs pa des sgra kho na la dmigs pa yin gyi bdag nyid du red pa bkag pa tsam ma yin na /üîΩde lta na gang zhig sgra med pa don du gnyer ba de la sgra dbyung dgos pa kho nar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te sgra 'i snga na med pa la dmigs pa des sgra kho na la dmigs pa yin gyi bdag nyid du red pa bkag pa tsam ma yin na / de lta na gang zhig sgra med pa don du gnyer ba de la sgra dbyung dgos pa kho nar 'gyur te /
translated: If the non-apprehension of sound's prior non-existence apprehends only sound, and not the mere negation of sound's existence,üîΩthen it would be necessary to produce sound for one who seeks the absence of sound.

original: des ni sgra don du gnyer bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: des ni sgra don du gnyer bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: For, he would seek sound,

original: sgra med pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sgra med pa ni ma yin no //
translated: not the absence of sound.

original: gal te ma 'ongs pa'i gnas skabs yin no zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gal te ma 'ongs pa'i gnas skabs yin no zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: If you say that it is the future state,

original: 'di snyam du der med do snyam pa'i blo ni da ltar ba de med do snyam pa de ltar 'dug go snyam na de'i phyir ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di snyam du der med do snyam pa'i blo ni da ltar ba de med do snyam pa de ltar 'dug go snyam na de'i phyir ma yin te /
translated: if you think that the cognition that thinks, It does not exist there, is the cognition that thinks, That present one does not exist, then in response to that,

original: gcig yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: gcig yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: it is said, Because it is one.

original: ma 'ongs pa gang yin pa de nyid da ltar yin no //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa gang yin pa de nyid da ltar yin no //
translated: That which is future is just present.

original: ji ltar da ltar med ces bya /
analyzed: ji ltar da ltar med ces bya /
translated: How can it be said that it does not exist in the present?

original: gzhan yang da lta yang ma 'ongs pa med pas der yang med do snyam pa'i blo yod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan yang da lta yang ma 'ongs pa med pas der yang med do snyam pa'i blo yod par 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, because the present does not exist in the future, the cognition that thinks, It does not exist there, would exist.

original: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro yang na bye brag gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni da ltar ba'i gnas skabs na mnyam par bya ba yin pa ste /
analyzed: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro yang na bye brag gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni da ltar ba'i gnas skabs na mnyam par bya ba yin pa ste /
translated: Or, that which is differentiated is that which is to be made equal in the present state.

original: de med pas da ltar med pa yin no zhes bya'o zhe na /
analyzed: de med pas da ltar med pa yin no zhes bya'o zhe na /
translated: Since that does not exist, it is said to be nonexistent in the present.

original: de ma byung ba las byung ba grub ste zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de ma byung ba las byung ba grub ste zhes bya ba nas /
translated: That which is not yet arisen is established as arisen,

original: ma 'ongs pa'i gnas skabs su ma byung ba las da ltar ba'i gnas skabs su byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i gnas skabs su ma byung ba las da ltar ba'i gnas skabs su byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because that which was not arisen in the future state is arisen in the present state.

original: yod pa dang med pa pa gnyi ga zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa pa gnyi ga zhes bya ba la /
translated: Both existent and nonexistent are observed.

original: da ltar byung ba'i gnas skabs na ni yod pa dmigs pa yin la /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i gnas skabs na ni yod pa dmigs pa yin la /
translated: In the present state, existence is observed.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i gnas skabs na ni med pa dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i gnas skabs na ni med pa dmigs pa yin no //
translated: In the future state, nonexistence is observed.

original: gal te med pa dmigs pa yin na 'o na byang chub sems dpa' zhes gsungs pa ji ltar drang /
analyzed: gal te med pa dmigs pa yin na 'o na byang chub sems dpa' zhes gsungs pa ji ltar drang /
translated: If nonexistence is observed, then how can it be said that the future exists?

original: gang 'jig rten na med pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: gang 'jig rten na med pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: Whatever does not exist in the world is said to be nonexistent.

original: de las ni de'i dmigs pa med pa nyid yin pa bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: de las ni de'i dmigs pa med pa nyid yin pa bkag pa yin no //
translated: and from that, the nonexistence of its object is refuted.

original: mngon pa'i nga rgyal can gzhan zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: mngon pa'i nga rgyal can gzhan zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: Others who are conceited about their knowledge, etc.

original: 'dir mdo'i dgongs pa ni ting nge 'dzin yongs su dag pa rnams snang ba med bzhin du ste /üîΩsbyor ba'i gnas skabs na lha'i mig gi @119a * //
analyzed: 'dir mdo'i dgongs pa ni ting nge 'dzin yongs su dag pa rnams snang ba med bzhin du ste / sbyor ba'i gnas skabs na lha'i mig gi @119a * //
translated: The intended meaning of the sutra is that those who have completely purified their concentration see the divine eye without appearance.üîΩIn the context of preparation, they see the divine eye as existing without appearance.

original: snang ba med bzhin du yod par lta'i bdag nyid lha'i mig gi snang ba gsal ba'i ngo bor yod pa kho na yod par lta'i zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: snang ba med bzhin du yod par lta'i bdag nyid lha'i mig gi snang ba gsal ba'i ngo bor yod pa kho na yod par lta'i zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
translated: They see the divine eye as existing in the nature of the clear appearance of the divine eye itself.

original: rtog par yang ga la 'gyur zhes bya ba ni yod dam med ces the tshom du ste /
analyzed: rtog par yang ga la 'gyur zhes bya ba ni yod dam med ces the tshom du ste /
translated: How could there be conceptualization?

original: blo rnams yod pa dang med pa'i yul can nyid yin na ni ;
analyzed: blo rnams yod pa dang med pa'i yul can nyid yin na ni ;
translated: If the mind has an existent or nonexistent object,üîΩthen the purpose of seeing both is accomplished.üîΩBut if it has an existent object, it is not accomplished.

original: de gnyi ga la lta ba'i dgos pa 'grub kyi yod pa'i yul can nyid ni mi 'grub bo yang na khyad par yang ci zhig yod ces bya ba la /
analyzed: de gnyi ga la lta ba'i dgos pa 'grub kyi yod pa'i yul can nyid ni mi 'grub bo yang na khyad par yang ci zhig yod ces bya ba la /
translated: Or, what is the difference?

original: gal te de dag kyang yod pa'i snang ba kho na lta'i med pa ma yin na ni gzhan dag las byang chub sems dpa' la khyad par ci zhig yod /
analyzed: gal te de dag kyang yod pa'i snang ba kho na lta'i med pa ma yin na ni gzhan dag las byang chub sems dpa' la khyad par ci zhig yod /
translated: If they are only the appearance of existence and not non-existence, then what is the difference between the Bodhisattva and others?

original: de ni gdon mi za bar de lta bu yin par zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de ni gdon mi za bar de lta bu yin par zhes bya ba la /
translated: ‚ÄúUndoubtedly, it is just so‚Äù means

original: ci zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhe na /
translated: what?

original: blo med pa la dmigs pa zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: blo med pa la dmigs pa zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar ro //
translated: ‚ÄúThe object of the non-existent mind‚Äù is supplied from the context.

original: 'di yod pa dang med pa gnyis blo'i yul yin pa nyid la dper brjod pa ni yod pa la yang yod par shes la /
analyzed: 'di yod pa dang med pa gnyis blo'i yul yin pa nyid la dper brjod pa ni yod pa la yang yod par shes la /
translated: The example of the existence and non-existence of both being the object of the mind is ‚Äúone knows existence as existence and

original: med pa la yang med par shes so zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: med pa la yang med par shes so zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
translated: one knows non-existence as non-existence.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir rnam par shes pa ni yod pa la dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de yang gtan tshigs su mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par shes pa ni yod pa la dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de yang gtan tshigs su mi rung ngo //
translated: Therefore, ‚Äúbecause consciousness has existence as its object‚Äù is also not a valid reason.

original: 'o na ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: Then what is it like?

original: de sngon du 'gro ba'i rgyud kyi khyad par las te zhes bya ba ni las sngon du 'gro ba'i sems kyi rgyud kyi khyad par las zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de sngon du 'gro ba'i rgyud kyi khyad par las te zhes bya ba ni las sngon du 'gro ba'i sems kyi rgyud kyi khyad par las zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is ‚Äúfrom the special continuum that precedes it‚Äù means the special continuum of mind that precedes the action.

original: de sngon du 'gro ba'i rgyud ni rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu dang rjes su mthun pa yang yod pas de'i phyir khyad par smos te /
analyzed: de sngon du 'gro ba'i rgyud ni rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu dang rjes su mthun pa yang yod pas de'i phyir khyad par smos te /
translated: The continuum that precedes it is also similar to the result that resembles its cause. Therefore, it is specified:

original: rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu dang rjes su mthun pa'i rgyud brtan par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu dang rjes su mthun pa'i rgyud brtan par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: in order to stabilize the continuum that is similar to the result that is its karmic maturation.

original: bdag tu smra ba dgag pa nas bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni rgyud yongs su 'gyur ba'i khyad par las te /
analyzed: bdag tu smra ba dgag pa nas bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni rgyud yongs su 'gyur ba'i khyad par las te /
translated: The refutation of the doctrine of self will be explained.

original: sa bon dang 'bras bu bzhin no zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: sa bon dang 'bras bu bzhin no zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
translated: The difference in the transformation of the continuum is like the difference between a seed and a fruit, etc.

original: gang gi 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa rdzas su yod pa ni btags par ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa rdzas su yod pa ni btags par ma yin no //
translated: That which exists substantially in the past and future is not imputed.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu la'o //
translated: In that, i.e., in the result,

original: de med par de yod pa med pa'i phyir 'bras bu'i yod pa skye bar bya ba la rgyu'i nus pa yin pas ma byung ba las byung ba zhes bya ba grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de med par de yod pa med pa'i phyir 'bras bu'i yod pa skye bar bya ba la rgyu'i nus pa yin pas ma byung ba las byung ba zhes bya ba grub pa yin no //
translated: since that does not exist without it, the power of the cause to generate the existence of the result is established as arising from what did not previously exist.

original: gal te 'bras bu rtag tu yod na ni de la las kyi nus pa med de /
analyzed: gal te 'bras bu rtag tu yod na ni de la las kyi nus pa med de /
translated: If the result always existed, then the power of karma would not exist.

original: de'i phyir dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las don med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las don med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it follows that virtuous and nonvirtuous karma would be pointless.

original: bye brag tu smra ba rnams ni skyed par nus so zhe 'o //
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba rnams ni skyed par nus so zhe 'o //
translated: Vaibhasikas say: It is able to generate.

original: gang gi zhe na las kyi'o //
analyzed: gang gi zhe na las kyi'o //
translated: What is it able to generate? Karma.

original: 'o na ni skye ba ma byung ba las byung ba zhes bya bar grub pa yin te /
analyzed: 'o na ni skye ba ma byung ba las byung ba zhes bya bar grub pa yin te /
translated: If that is so, then it is established that arising occurs from that which has not yet arisen.

original: khyad par de sngar @119b med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par de sngar @119b med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that distinction did not exist previously.

original: yang thams cad du yod pa kho na yin zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yang thams cad du yod pa kho na yin zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Again, it is said that it exists in all moments.

original: las de dang 'bras bu dang skye ba'o //
analyzed: las de dang 'bras bu dang skye ba'o //
translated: Karma, its result and arising exist.

original: da ni gang la zhes bya ba ste skye ba'am 'bras bu la las sam gzhan yang rung ste rgyu gang zhig nus te /
analyzed: da ni gang la zhes bya ba ste skye ba'am 'bras bu la las sam gzhan yang rung ste rgyu gang zhig nus te /
translated: Now, what is the cause of arising or the result of karma, or anything else, that is able to generate it?

original: thams cad kyi tshe rdzas su yod pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad kyi tshe rdzas su yod pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because all are substantially existent.

original: 'o na da ltar du byed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni las dang 'bras bu yod bzhin du'o //
analyzed: 'o na da ltar du byed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni las dang 'bras bu yod bzhin du'o //
translated: If you say that it is present at the time of the result, then karma and its result would exist simultaneously.

original: yul gzhan du 'dren pa yin no zhes bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa yul na mi gnas pas zhes bya ba'i bsam pa 'dis smras pa'o //
analyzed: yul gzhan du 'dren pa yin no zhes bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa yul na mi gnas pas zhes bya ba'i bsam pa 'dis smras pa'o //
translated: The response, ‚ÄúIt is led to another place,‚Äù is offered with the intention that the future does not exist in a place.

original: rtag par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni de 'dren pa'i rkyen rnams rtag tu nye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni de 'dren pa'i rkyen rnams rtag tu nye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The consequence is that it would be permanent, because the conditions that lead to it would always be present.

original: gzugs can ma yin pa ste tshor ba la sogs pa rnams la de ji ltar te /
analyzed: gzugs can ma yin pa ste tshor ba la sogs pa rnams la de ji ltar te /
translated: How could that be so for those that are not form, such as feeling?

original: 'dren zhes bya ba dang sbyar te /
analyzed: 'dren zhes bya ba dang sbyar te /
translated: The response, ‚ÄúIt is led,‚Äù is offered.

original: de rnams ni rtag tu yul na mi gnas pas dris pa yin no //
analyzed: de rnams ni rtag tu yul na mi gnas pas dris pa yin no //
translated: Those that are not form do not exist in a place.

original: 'bras bu'i 'dren pa bya ba'i ming can gang yin pa de yang ma byung ba las byung ba yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i 'dren pa bya ba'i ming can gang yin pa de yang ma byung ba las byung ba yin te /
translated: That which is called the activity of leading to the effect is also that which arises from what was previously nonexistent.

original: de ni sngar yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni sngar yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is because it did not exist previously.

original: gal te rang gi ngo bo'i khyad par zhig ces bya ba la da ltar ba byed pas de la las kyi nus pa yod pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rang gi ngo bo'i khyad par zhig ces bya ba la da ltar ba byed pas de la las kyi nus pa yod pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is a particular intrinsic nature, then the activity of the present is the cause of its existence.

original: khyad par de sngar med pas ma byung ba las byung ba grub pa yin no //
analyzed: khyad par de sngar med pas ma byung ba las byung ba grub pa yin no //
translated: That particular intrinsic nature is established as that which arises from what was previously nonexistent, because it did not exist previously.

original: ji ltar sngar yod pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar sngar yod pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is just as it was before,

original: da ltar bar byas pas 'di la khyad par yod pa ma yin pas las kyi nus pa med pas so na 'dug pa nyid do //üîΩgal te skye mched bcu gnyis yod kyi /
analyzed: da ltar bar byas pas 'di la khyad par yod pa ma yin pas las kyi nus pa med pas so na 'dug pa nyid do // gal te skye mched bcu gnyis yod kyi /
translated: then it is not different now, and so it remains without the power of action.

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa med na /
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa med na /
translated: If the twelve bases exist, but the past and future do not,

original: yid kyi skye mched 'das pa ji ltar gzhag ce na /
analyzed: yid kyi skye mched 'das pa ji ltar gzhag ce na /
translated: how can the past mental faculty be posited?

original: smras pa / rnam par shes pa da ltar ba kho na rnam par shes pa gzhan gyi rten gyi dngos por rnam par gnas kyi /
analyzed: smras pa / rnam par shes pa da ltar ba kho na rnam par shes pa gzhan gyi rten gyi dngos por rnam par gnas kyi /
translated: We say: Only the present consciousness is the basis of another consciousness.

original: 'das pa ni ma yin pas skyon 'di med do //
analyzed: 'das pa ni ma yin pas skyon 'di med do //
translated: The past is not, so this error does not arise.

original: yang na dus gsum ste /
analyzed: yang na dus gsum ste /
translated: Or, the three times exist.

original: ci zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhe na /
translated: What?

original: thams cad yod pa zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: thams cad yod pa zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar ro //
translated: Everything exists.

original: gal te dus gsum yod do zhes brjod na /
analyzed: gal te dus gsum yod do zhes brjod na /
translated: If you say that the three times exist,

original: 'o na ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa grub bo zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa grub bo zhe na /
translated: then the past and future are established.

original: de'i phyir ji ltar yod pa de bzhin du ni bshad zin to zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir ji ltar yod pa de bzhin du ni bshad zin to zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore it is said: We have explained how they exist.

original: sngon byung ba gang yin pa de ni 'das pa yin no //
analyzed: sngon byung ba gang yin pa de ni 'das pa yin no //
translated: That which occurred in the past is past.

original: rgyu yod na 'byung bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni ma 'ongs pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu yod na 'byung bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni ma 'ongs pa yin no //
translated: That which will occur if its cause exists is future.

original: byung nas ma zhig pa gang yin pa de ni da ltar ba yin no zhes bya bar ro //
analyzed: byung nas ma zhig pa gang yin pa de ni da ltar ba yin no zhes bya bar ro //
translated: That which has occurred and not yet ceased is present.

original: ji ltar na des dar ldan pa yin zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ji ltar na des dar ldan pa yin zhes bya ba ni /
translated: How can it be related to that?

original: ji ltar 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i nyon mongs pa des sam 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po der ldan pa yin zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i nyon mongs pa des sam 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po der ldan pa yin zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: How can past or future affliction or the state of being past or future be related to that?

original: de las skyes pa de'i rgyu'i @120a * //üîΩphra rgyas yod pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa des zhes bya ba la 'das pa'i nyon mongs pa de las skyes pa ni de las skyes pa'o //
analyzed: de las skyes pa de'i rgyu'i @120a * // phra rgyas yod pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa des zhes bya ba la 'das pa'i nyon mongs pa de las skyes pa ni de las skyes pa'o //
translated: Because it arises from that, it is related to that as cause.üîΩBecause the past affliction arises from that, it is related to that as cause.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i phra rgyas de'i rgyu ni de'i rgyu'o //üîΩde ni de las skyes pa yang yin la /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i phra rgyas de'i rgyu ni de'i rgyu'o // de ni de las skyes pa yang yin la /
translated: Because the future negative tendency is its cause, it is related to that as cause.üîΩIt arises from that and is its cause.

original: de'i rgyu yang yin pas de las skyes pa de'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: de'i rgyu yang yin pas de las skyes pa de'i rgyu'o //
translated: Therefore, it is related to that as cause.

original: de las skyes pa de'i rgyu nyid phra rgyas yin pa ni de'i rgyu de las skyes pa'i phra rgyas so //
analyzed: de las skyes pa de'i rgyu nyid phra rgyas yin pa ni de'i rgyu de las skyes pa'i phra rgyas so //
translated: The cause of that which arises from that is the negative tendency.

original: de yod pa ni de las skyes pa'i de'i rgyu phra rgyas yod pa ste /
analyzed: de yod pa ni de las skyes pa'i de'i rgyu phra rgyas yod pa ste /
translated: The existence of that is the existence of the negative tendency that is the cause of that which arises from that.

original: de las skyes pa de'i rgyu phra rgyas yod pa de'i phyir 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i nyon mongs pa des ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las skyes pa de'i rgyu phra rgyas yod pa de'i phyir 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i nyon mongs pa des ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of the existence of the negative tendency that is the cause of that which arises from that, one is said to be endowed with past and future affliction.

original: de la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i phra rgyas yod pas dngos po dang ldan pa yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i phra rgyas yod pas dngos po dang ldan pa yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: One is endowed with the thing because the negative tendency of affliction that focuses on that exists.

original: de la dmigs pa yang yin la /
analyzed: de la dmigs pa yang yin la /
translated: It is that because it is the object of that.

original: nyon mongs pa yang yin pas de la dmigs pa nyon mongs pa ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa yang yin pas de la dmigs pa nyon mongs pa ste /
translated: It is the negative tendency of affliction that focuses on that because it is both the object of that and the affliction.

original: de la zhes bya ba 'di ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba 'di ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang sbyar ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúthat‚Äù is connected to the past and future.

original: de la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i phra rgyas ni de la de dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i phra rgyas so//
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i phra rgyas ni de la de dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i phra rgyas so//
translated: The negative tendency of affliction that focuses on that is the negative tendency of affliction that focuses on that.

original: de yang gang zhig ce na /
analyzed: de yang gang zhig ce na /
translated: What is that?

original: nyon mongs pa'i bag chags te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i bag chags te /
translated: It is the latent tendency of affliction.

original: nyon mongs pa'i sa bon zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩde la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i phra rgyas yod pa ni /üîΩde la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i phra rgyas yod pa ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sa bon zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // de la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i phra rgyas yod pa ni / de la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i phra rgyas yod pa ste /
translated: The term ‚Äúhaving‚Äù refers to the possession of the mental afflictions.üîΩThe term ‚Äúhaving‚Äù refers to the possession of the mental afflictions that are associated with those objects.üîΩThe term ‚Äúhaving‚Äù refers to the possession of the mental afflictions that are associated with those objects.üîΩThe term ‚Äúhaving‚Äù refers to the possession of the mental afflictions that are associated with those objects.

analyzed: nyon mongs can min mthong spang min // gzugs min drug pa min skyes min //

original: zhes nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes nges pa'i phyir ro //

original: gzugs na spyod pa rnam pa lnga //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzugs na spyod pa rnam pa lnga // zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa'i sa pa yid kyi ni nyon mongs pa rnam pa lnga dang mtshungs par ldan pas sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba nas bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i bar du yin te /
translated: The mental faculty of the third absorption level is concomitant with the five types of affliction and is abandoned by the path of seeing the truth of suffering and by the path of meditation.

original: bsam gtan dang po dang gsum pa'i sa pa'i bde ba'i dbang po 'di ni bsdoms nas gzugs na spyod pa rnam pa lda zhes bshad do //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po dang gsum pa'i sa pa'i bde ba'i dbang po 'di ni bsdoms nas gzugs na spyod pa rnam pa lda zhes bshad do //
translated: This faculty of pleasure of the first and third meditation stages is explained as being of eleven types when combined.

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa dang bzhi pa dang gzugs med pa dag na ni bde ba'i dbang po med pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa dang bzhi pa dang gzugs med pa dag na ni bde ba'i dbang po med pa kho na yin no //
translated: In the second and fourth meditations and the formless realms, there is only the faculty of pleasure.

original: zag pa med pa'o zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan gsum pa la brten pa'i chos dang rjes su shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'o //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'o zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan gsum pa la brten pa'i chos dang rjes su shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'o //
translated: The third meditation stage is the stage of the uncontaminated, i.e., the side of the path of seeing that is compatible with the knowledge of the doctrine and subsequent knowledge that are based on the third meditation stage.

original: 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba ma gtogs pa 'dod pa na spyod pa rnam pa bzhi dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba ma gtogs pa 'dod pa na spyod pa rnam pa bzhi dang zhes bya ba la /

original: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung mthong bas spang bar bya ba skal ba mnyam pa'i khams kun du 'gro ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i bde ba'i dbang po yin la /

translated: The faculty of pleasure in the desire realm is the object of the consciousness that is concomitant with the universal of the same realm that is to be eliminated by seeing the truths of suffering and origin.

original: de nyid skal pa mi mnyam pa'i khams kun du 'gro ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i dmigs pa ni gzugs na spyod pa rnam pa lnga char yang yin no //
analyzed: de nyid skal pa mi mnyam pa'i khams kun du 'gro ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i dmigs pa ni gzugs na spyod pa rnam pa lnga char yang yin no //

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba log par lta ba la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i dmigs pa ni bsam gtan gsum pa'i sa pa'i bde ba'i dbang po'i zag pa med pa'i chos shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa yin no //

translated: The focal object of wrong view and so on concomitant with objects to be abandoned by seeing the truth of path in the desire realm is the uncontaminated phenomena that are the aspect of the faculty of pleasure of the third absorption.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i bsgom pas spang bar bya ba nyon mongs pa can dang nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i dmigs pa ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i bde ba'i dbang po yin la /

translated: The focal object of afflicted and unafflicted objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation in the desire realm is the faculty of pleasure of the desire realm.

original: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa kho na'i dmigs pa ni khams gong ma'i rnam pa lnga char yang yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa kho na'i dmigs pa ni khams gong ma'i rnam pa lnga char yang yin no //

original: 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba ma gtogs pa zhes @123b bya ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba ma gtogs pa zhes @123b bya ba 'byung ste /
translated: The phrase except for that which is to be abandoned by seeing the truth of cessation occurs.

original: de la zag pa med pa la dmigs pa gang yin pa de'i dmigs pa 'gog pa kho na yin zhing /üîΩgang zhig zag pa dang bcas pa la dmigs pa de'i dmigs pa yang log par lta ba la sogs pa yin la 'dod pa na spyod pa'i log bar lta ba la sogs pa dag ni /

translated: That which focuses on the uncontaminated truth of cessation focuses on cessation alone.üîΩThat which focuses on contaminated states focuses on wrong view and so on.

original: bde ba'i dbang po dang mtshungs par mi ldan te /
analyzed: bde ba'i dbang po dang mtshungs par mi ldan te /
translated: Wrong view and so on that focuses on the desire realm is not concomitant with the faculty of pleasure because

translated: The faculty of pleasure in the desire realm is the focal object of the form realm that is abandoned by the path of meditation alone when one is disgusted with the desire realm.

original: bsam gtan dang po'i sa ba ni sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung mthong bas spang bar bya ba skal ba mnyam pa'i khams kun du 'gro ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i dmigs pa yin te /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po'i sa ba ni sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung mthong bas spang bar bya ba skal ba mnyam pa'i khams kun du 'gro ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i dmigs pa yin te /

analyzed: gzugs med dngos gzhi dge rnams ni //

translated: Because ƒÅryas born in the formless realm focus on the uncontaminated path of the third absorption through contaminated virtuous consciousness by the power of prior habituation.

analyzed: chos shes pa'i phyogs kyi dmigs pa ni bde ba'i dbang po 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / chos dang rjes su shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa yin no //

analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni bde ba'i dbang po la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnam pa bcu gnyis pa'o //

translated: The class of objects to be abandoned by seeing the truth of path that are wrongly viewed and so on focus on uncontaminated states and they increase through the power of concomitance alone with minds to be abandoned by seeing the truth of path.
