translated: The proclivities that are abandoned by the mind associated with them.

original: yang phra rgyas dang bcas pa'i sems gang zhig yin la /
analyzed: yang phra rgyas dang bcas pa'i sems gang zhig yin la /
translated: What is the mind that is associated with the proclivities?

original: de dag ji ltar phra rgyas dang bcas pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de dag ji ltar phra rgyas dang bcas pa yin zhe na /
translated: How are they associated with the proclivities?

original: re zhig zag pa dang bcas pa ni @126b ji skad du bshad pa'i khams gsum pa rnam pa bco lnga'o //
analyzed: re zhig zag pa dang bcas pa ni @126b ji skad du bshad pa'i khams gsum pa rnam pa bco lnga'o //
translated: First, the contaminated is the fifteen aspects of the three realms, as explained.

original: rnam pa gnyis kyis ni phra rgyas dang bcas pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis kyis ni phra rgyas dang bcas pa zhes bya ste /
translated: It is called associated with the proclivities in two ways:

original: rgyas par 'gyur ba'i ngo bo dang lhan cig pa'i ngo bos so //
analyzed: rgyas par 'gyur ba'i ngo bo dang lhan cig pa'i ngo bos so //
translated: by the nature of increasing and by the nature of coexisting.

original: ji srid du phra rgyas de'i thob pa dag gi sems de'i rgyud bzung bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: ji srid du phra rgyas de'i thob pa dag gi sems de'i rgyud bzung bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: As long as the acquisition of the proclivities holds the continuum of that mind,

original: rgyud de la ma 'ongs pa'i rgyu mthun pa'i rgyu gzhag bde srid du phra rgyas de sems de la rgyas par brjod do //
analyzed: rgyud de la ma 'ongs pa'i rgyu mthun pa'i rgyu gzhag bde srid du phra rgyas de sems de la rgyas par brjod do //
translated: It is said that negative tendencies increase in that mind since they are the future homogeneous cause of that mindstream.

original: spangs pa ni gnyen po skyes nas thob pa'i 'ching ba dang bral ba'i phyir rgyas par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: spangs pa ni gnyen po skyes nas thob pa'i 'ching ba dang bral ba'i phyir rgyas par mi 'gyur te /
translated: They do not increase through abandonment because they do not increase through the arising of their antidote and they are free from the bonds of affliction.

original: gang zhig de dang lhan cig rgyu ba nyid kyis lhan cig pa'i dngos po yin pa de ni gnyen pos bsal bar mi nus pas spangs kyang des sems de zag pa dang bcas pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig de dang lhan cig rgyu ba nyid kyis lhan cig pa'i dngos po yin pa de ni gnyen pos bsal bar mi nus pas spangs kyang des sems de zag pa dang bcas pa kho na yin no //
translated: That which is a concomitant thing through being concomitant with it cannot be eliminated by an antidote. Therefore, even though they are abandoned, that mind is still concomitant with them and thus possesses them.

original: de la 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i ma rig pas lhan cig pa'i dngos po dang / rgyas par 'gyur ba'i dngos pos phra rgyas dang bcas pa yin la /
analyzed: de la 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i ma rig pas lhan cig pa'i dngos po dang / rgyas par 'gyur ba'i dngos pos phra rgyas dang bcas pa yin la /
translated: The mind concomitant with the afflicted view of the self possesses negative tendencies through the thing of concomitance and the thing of increase because it is concomitant with the afflicted view of the self and ignorance concomitant with it.

original: rang gi rig pa lhag ma dag dang / kun 'byung mthong pas spang bar bya ba kun du 'gro ba dag gis ni rgyas par 'gyur ba'i dngos po'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: rang gi rig pa lhag ma dag dang / kun 'byung mthong pas spang bar bya ba kun du 'gro ba dag gis ni rgyas par 'gyur ba'i dngos po'i sgo nas so //
translated: The remaining proclivities of the same stage and the pervasive proclivities abandoned by the path of vision of the truths of origin and path are the objects that nourish the proclivity of attachment to pleasure.

original: lhag ma dag gis ni gnyi gas kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: lhag ma dag gis ni gnyi gas kyang ma yin no //
translated: The remaining proclivities are not nourished by either.

original: nyon mongs pa gzhan yang de bzhin du ci rigs par dpyad par bya'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa gzhan yang de bzhin du ci rigs par dpyad par bya'o //
translated: Other afflicted states should be analyzed in the same way, as appropriate.

original: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa ni rang gi ris pa dag dang / kun du 'gro ba dag gis rgyas par 'gyur ba'i do bo zag pa dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa ni rang gi ris pa dag dang / kun du 'gro ba dag gis rgyas par 'gyur ba'i do bo zag pa dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: Undefiled states are objects that nourish proclivities of their own class and pervasive proclivities.

original: mdor bsdu ba ni nyon mongs phra rgyas bcas rnam gnyis te /üîΩnyon mongs pa can spangs pa dang / ma spangs pa thams cad ni rgyas par 'gyur ba dang / rgyas par 'gyur ba ma yin pas /
analyzed: mdor bsdu ba ni nyon mongs phra rgyas bcas rnam gnyis te / nyon mongs pa can spangs pa dang / ma spangs pa thams cad ni rgyas par 'gyur ba dang / rgyas par 'gyur ba ma yin pas /
translated: In brief, there are two types of affliction:üîΩthose that are abandoned and those that are not abandoned.

original: phra rgyas dang bcas pa ma yin la /
analyzed: phra rgyas dang bcas pa ma yin la /
translated: Those that are abandoned are not objects that nourish proclivities.

original: rgyas par 'gyur ba rnams kyis kyang rnam pa gnyis kyis phra rgyas dang bcas pa yin te /
analyzed: rgyas par 'gyur ba rnams kyis kyang rnam pa gnyis kyis phra rgyas dang bcas pa yin te /
translated: Those that are not abandoned are objects that nourish proclivities in two ways:

original: lhan cig pa'i dngos po dang / rgyas par 'gyur ba'i dngos pos so zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: lhan cig pa'i dngos po dang / rgyas par 'gyur ba'i dngos pos so zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
translated: by the factor of concomitance and by the factor of development.

original: de la gang rnams kyis yin zhes bya ba mi shes pas de'i phyir de dang mtshungs bar ldan pa dang de la dmigs pa'am zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de la gang rnams kyis yin zhes bya ba mi shes pas de'i phyir de dang mtshungs bar ldan pa dang de la dmigs pa'am zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Since it is not known by what these are, he says: by those that are concomitant with it and by those that focus on it.

original: ci thams cad kyi tshe na yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: ci thams cad kyi tshe na yin nam zhe na /
translated: Are they at all times?

original: smras pa ma yin te /
analyzed: smras pa ma yin te /
translated: He says: No.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: Then what?

original: ma spangs pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ma spangs pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says: those that have not been abandoned.

original: sems de dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang / de la dmigs pa yang ma spangs pa'i phra rgyas gang dag yin pa'o //
analyzed: sems de dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang / de la dmigs pa yang ma spangs pa'i phra rgyas gang dag yin pa'o //
translated: Those that are concomitant with that mind and those that focus on it are the negative tendencies that have not been abandoned.

original: rgyas par mi 'gyur ba rnams kyis kyang zhes bya ba la /üîΩphra rgyas @127a * //
analyzed: rgyas par mi 'gyur ba rnams kyis kyang zhes bya ba la / phra rgyas @127a * //
translated: By those that do not develop,

original: dang bcas pa yin te zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: dang bcas pa yin te zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: it is associated with negative tendencies.

original: ji ltar byas nas she na /
analyzed: ji ltar byas nas she na /
translated: How is it so?

original: de dang mtshungs par ldan zhing zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de dang mtshungs par ldan zhing zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: He says: by those that are concomitant with it.

original: gal te spangs na ji ltar phra rgyas dang bcas pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te spangs na ji ltar phra rgyas dang bcas pa yin zhe na /
translated: If they have been abandoned, how can it be associated with negative tendencies?

original: de nyid la rgyu bshad pa ni de dang lhan cig pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de nyid la rgyu bshad pa ni de dang lhan cig pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The explanation of the cause of that is ‚Äúbecause it is concomitant with that.‚Äù

original: gnyen pos ni nam yang sems nyon mongs pa las logs shig tu bya bar mi nus so //üîΩnyon mongs can min rgyas 'gyur gyis //
analyzed: gnyen pos ni nam yang sems nyon mongs pa las logs shig tu bya bar mi nus so // nyon mongs can min rgyas 'gyur gyis //
translated: The antidote never has the ability to separate the mind from affliction.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: The root text states, ‚ÄúThe non-afflicted increases through development.‚Äù

original: phra rgyas dang bcas zhes bya bar sbyar ro //üîΩphra rgyas med pa ni spangs pa ste /
analyzed: phra rgyas dang bcas zhes bya bar sbyar ro // phra rgyas med pa ni spangs pa ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúpossessing negative tendencies‚Äù should be supplied.

original: de la dmigs pa'i kun du 'gro ba rnams sngar spangs zin pa'i phyir dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rnams phyis spong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i kun du 'gro ba rnams sngar spangs zin pa'i phyir dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rnams phyis spong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The non-afflicted is abandoned through the path of meditation, because the pervasive negative tendencies that focus on it have already been abandoned and because the negative tendencies that are abandoned by the path of meditation are abandoned later.

original: yang phra rgyas bcu po 'di dag ji ltar 'jug par 'gyur zhe na zhes bya ba 'byung ngo //
analyzed: yang phra rgyas bcu po 'di dag ji ltar 'jug par 'gyur zhe na zhes bya ba 'byung ngo //
translated: How do these ten negative tendencies operate?

original: thams cad thams cad kyi mjug thogs su skye ba'i phyir 'di dag skye ba la skye ba thams cad kyi la ni rim pa nges pa med mod kyi /
analyzed: thams cad thams cad kyi mjug thogs su skye ba'i phyir 'di dag skye ba la skye ba thams cad kyi la ni rim pa nges pa med mod kyi /
translated: Although there is no fixed order for the arising of all negative tendencies, they do arise in a fixed order.

original: phal cher skye ba dang mthun pa'i sgo nas srid tshad la rim pa bstan pa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: phal cher skye ba dang mthun pa'i sgo nas srid tshad la rim pa bstan pa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: For the most part, the order of the members is taught in accordance with the order of their arising.

original: re zhig dang po kho nang ma rig pa dang ldan pa las zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: re zhig dang po kho nang ma rig pa dang ldan pa las zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
translated: First, from the beginningless beginning, due to the presence of ignorance, etc.

original: sdug bsngal phung po bsal nas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sdug bsngal phung po bsal nas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Having removed the mass of suffering,

original: 'di ni sdug bsngal ma yin no zhes bya bar ro //
analyzed: 'di ni sdug bsngal ma yin no zhes bya bar ro //
translated: one should not think, ‚ÄúThis is not suffering.‚Äù

original: bdag tu mngon par zhen pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bdag tu mngon par zhen pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because of the manifest clinging to a self.

original: 'dir bsam pa ni sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i rnam pa dag las bsal ba ste /
analyzed: 'dir bsam pa ni sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i rnam pa dag las bsal ba ste /
translated: The idea here is that one should remove the mass of suffering, etc.,

original: de'i phyir dgra bo'i rnam par 'dzin pa las mngon par zhen pas de'i spyi'i rnam pa la log par rtog par shes kyi thams cad la skur pa btab pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dgra bo'i rnam par 'dzin pa las mngon par zhen pas de'i spyi'i rnam pa la log par rtog par shes kyi thams cad la skur pa btab pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di yin te /
translated: Therefore, due to manifest clinging to the aspect of an enemy, one should understand that there is a misconception of the general aspect, but not a denial of everything,

original: gzhi med na de'i dgra zla'i rnam pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhi med na de'i dgra zla'i rnam pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because if there is no basis, the aspect of an enemy is impossible.

original: grag go zhes bya ba'i sgra smos pa ni /
analyzed: grag go zhes bya ba'i sgra smos pa ni /
translated: The word ‚Äúit is said‚Äù is usedüîΩbecause this is a matter of hearsay.

original: log par lta ba las 'jig tshogs la lta ba kho na 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i nges pa med par bstan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: log par lta ba las 'jig tshogs la lta ba kho na 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i nges pa med par bstan pa'i phyir te /
translated: The response is that the assertion that only the afflicted view of the self arises from the wrong view is not definite.

original: 'di ltar res 'ga' mchog gam gtso bor 'dzin pa las lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa yang de'i mjug thogs su 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar res 'ga' mchog gam gtso bor 'dzin pa las lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa yang de'i mjug thogs su 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: For sometimes clinging to rules and ritual as supreme arises after clinging to those as the best.

original: dgra bor gyur pa zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa'i lta ba yang /üîΩde'i dgra bo yin mod kyi de la dmigs pa'i zhe sdang ni /
analyzed: dgra bor gyur pa zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa'i lta ba yang / de'i dgra bo yin mod kyi de la dmigs pa'i zhe sdang ni /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthat is an enemy‚Äù means that the correct view is an enemy of the wrong view.

original: mthong bas spang bar bya ba mi rung ste /
analyzed: mthong bas spang bar bya ba mi rung ste /
translated: However, it is not tenable that the hatred that focuses on it is to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: de ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is to be abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: de'i phyir bdag gzugs yin no zhes bya ba de ltar lta ba'i dgra bo ni sems pa la sogs pa bdag tu 'dzin pa'i lta ba yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag gzugs yin no zhes bya ba de ltar lta ba'i dgra bo ni sems pa la sogs pa bdag tu 'dzin pa'i lta ba yin te /
translated: Therefore the enemy of the view that the self is form is the view that apprehends such things as volition to be the self.

original: lta ba gzhan dang ldan pa'i lta ba gzhan @127b la yang de dang 'dra bar sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: lta ba gzhan dang ldan pa'i lta ba gzhan @127b la yang de dang 'dra bar sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: This should be applied in the same way to other views.

original: rang gi rgyud la yod pa'i lta ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams ni kha nang du bltas te 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi rgyud la yod pa'i lta ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams ni kha nang du bltas te 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Attachment and so on that are to be abandoned by the path of seeing are internal since they engage their objects by focusing inward.

original: yang ji ltar nyon mongs pa skye zhe na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar nyon mongs pa skye zhe na /
translated: How do afflictions arise?

original: de skye ba'i rgyu ni mang po zhig mthong ste /
analyzed: de skye ba'i rgyu ni mang po zhig mthong ste /
translated: There are many causes for their arising,üîΩsuch as the excellence of a homogeneous continuum, objects, pleasure, drinking alcohol, and specific states of familiarity.

original: ris mthun phun sum tshogs pa dang / yul dang / bde ba dang / chang 'thungs pa dang / goms pa'i khyad par la sogs pa rgyu dag yin mod kyi skye ba na gtso bo'i rgyu gsum gyis skye ste /
analyzed: ris mthun phun sum tshogs pa dang / yul dang / bde ba dang / chang 'thungs pa dang / goms pa'i khyad par la sogs pa rgyu dag yin mod kyi skye ba na gtso bo'i rgyu gsum gyis skye ste /
translated: However, when they arise, they arise due to three primary causes.

original: phra rgyas spangs pa ma yin dang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: phra rgyas spangs pa ma yin dang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: The Abhidharmakosa states, They arise due to not abandoning negative tendencies,üîΩnot fully understanding the focal object, and the presence of conditions.

original: ma spangs shing zhes bya ba ni de'i thob pa ma bcad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma spangs shing zhes bya ba ni de'i thob pa ma bcad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Not abandoning means that the obtainment of those negative tendencies is not severed.

original: yongs su ma shes pa yin zhes bya ba ni de'i gnyen po ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs su ma shes pa yin zhes bya ba ni de'i gnyen po ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Not fully understanding means that their antidote does not arise.

original: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyi kun nas dkris pa dang mthun pa'i chos rnams kyang snang bar gyur pa yin zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyi kun nas dkris pa dang mthun pa'i chos rnams kyang snang bar gyur pa yin zhes bya ba ni /
translated: and the things that are favorable to the fetter of sensual desire appear.

original: 'di dag gi kun nas dkris pas na kun nas dkris pa dang mthun pa ste /
analyzed: 'di dag gi kun nas dkris pas na kun nas dkris pa dang mthun pa ste /
translated: They are favorable to the fetter because of the fetter.

original: dper na 'dis myos par byed pas na myos par 'gyur ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na 'dis myos par byed pas na myos par 'gyur ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is called intoxicant because it intoxicates.

original: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyi kun nas dkris pa dang mthun pa ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyi kun nas dkris pa dang mthun pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyi kun nas dkris pa dang mthun pa ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyi kun nas dkris pa dang mthun pa ste /
translated: The things that are favorable to the fetter of sensual desire are favorable to the fetter of sensual desire.

original: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyi kun nas dkris pa dang rjes su mthun pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyi kun nas dkris pa dang rjes su mthun pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that they are in conformity with the fetter of sensual desire.

original: de dag kyang gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa yul rnams so //
analyzed: de dag kyang gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa yul rnams so //
translated: And those are the objects such as form, sound, etc.

original: snang bar gyur pa zhig ces bya ba ni yul gyi dngos por gnas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: snang bar gyur pa zhig ces bya ba ni yul gyi dngos por gnas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúappear to him‚Äù means that they exist as objects.

original: de la yang tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa yin zhes bya ba ni snang bar gyur pa'i yul de la'o //
analyzed: de la yang tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa yin zhes bya ba ni snang bar gyur pa'i yul de la'o //
translated: And with regard to them, there is incorrect mental activity.

original: yid la byed pa phyin ci log ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: yid la byed pa phyin ci log ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa'o //
translated: Incorrect mental application is incorrect attention.

original: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyi phra rgyas de ni rgyu'i stobs so //
analyzed: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyi phra rgyas de ni rgyu'i stobs so //
translated: The power of cause is the persistence of the negative tendencies of desire realm attachment that are the equivalent immediately preceding condition.

original: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyi kun nas dkris pa dang mthun pa'i chos rnams ni yul gyi stobs so //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyi kun nas dkris pa dang mthun pa'i chos rnams ni yul gyi stobs so //
translated: The power of the object is the objects that are compatible with the entanglements of desire realm attachment.

original: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa ni sbyor ba'i stobs so //
analyzed: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa ni sbyor ba'i stobs so //
translated: The power of application is incorrect mental application.

original: gal te nyon mongs ba rgyu gsum gyis skye bar 'dod na ji ltar dgra bcom pa yongs su nyams par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te nyon mongs ba rgyu gsum gyis skye bar 'dod na ji ltar dgra bcom pa yongs su nyams par 'gyur te /
translated: If you assert that affliction arises due to three powers, how could arhats retrogress?

original: de la phra rgyas ma spangs pa 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de la phra rgyas ma spangs pa 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because they do not possess any negative tendencies that are not abandoned.

original: nyes pa 'di ni med de rgyu tshang ba kho na rgyu gsum gyis skye bar 'dod kyi /
analyzed: nyes pa 'di ni med de rgyu tshang ba kho na rgyu gsum gyis skye bar 'dod kyi /
translated: This fault does not exist because it is asserted that affliction arises due to three powers only when the causes are complete.

original: thams cad ni ma yin no //
analyzed: thams cad ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not asserted that it arises due to all three powers.

original: res 'ga' yul gyi stobs kho nas skye'i zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: res 'ga' yul gyi stobs kho nas skye'i zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: Sometimes it arises due to the power of the object alone.

original: grag go @128a * //
analyzed: grag go @128a * //
translated: This is the extensive explanation.

original: zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rgyu ma tshang ba'i 'bras bu ni skye ba yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rgyu ma tshang ba'i 'bras bu ni skye ba yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúonly‚Äù is stated in order to show that an effect does not arise when the cause is incomplete.

original: sbyor ba bzhi ste de dag nyid do zhes bya ba ni 'dod ba'i sbyor ba dang / srid pa'i sbyor ba dang / lta ba'i sbyor ba dang / ma rig pa'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba bzhi ste de dag nyid do zhes bya ba ni 'dod ba'i sbyor ba dang / srid pa'i sbyor ba dang / lta ba'i sbyor ba dang / ma rig pa'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: There are four bonds: the bonds of desire, the bonds of existence, the bonds of views, and the bonds of ignorance.

original: phra rgyas kho na zhes nges par gzung ba ni kun dkris pa bsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phra rgyas kho na zhes nges par gzung ba ni kun dkris pa bsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúonly the proclivities‚Äù is stated in order to exclude the entanglements.

original: ma rig pa logs shig kho nar ma rig pa'i zag par bshad pa de'i phyir ma rig pa ma gtogs par zhes bya bar sbyar te zhes bya ba smos so //

original: ji ltar zhe na /

original: kun du sbyor ba tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa smos pa'i phyir don gyis gzhan gyi cha dang mthun pa yang yod do zhes bshad par 'gyur bas de'i phyir /üîΩgong ma'i cha dang mthun lnga nyid //
analyzed: kun du sbyor ba tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa smos pa'i phyir don gyis gzhan gyi cha dang mthun pa yang yod do zhes bshad par 'gyur bas de'i phyir / gong ma'i cha dang mthun lnga nyid //
translated: Since the term fetter associated with the higher realms is mentioned, it is explained that the term fetter associated with the other realms also exists by implication. Therefore, it is said:

original: ces bya ba smos so //
analyzed: ces bya ba smos so //
translated: There are five associated with the higher realms.

original: gong ma'i cha ni gzugs kyi khams dang / gzugs med pa'i khams dang / de dang mthun pa'i phyir na gong ma'i cha dang mthun pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gong ma'i cha ni gzugs kyi khams dang / gzugs med pa'i khams dang / de dang mthun pa'i phyir na gong ma'i cha dang mthun pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The higher realms are the form realm and the formless realm. Because they are similar to that, they are called associated with the higher realms.

original: @132b ji ltar 'di dag de dang mthun pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: @132b ji ltar 'di dag de dang mthun pa yin zhe na /
translated: How are they similar to that?

original: de'i phyir de dag ma spangs par khams gong ma las mi 'da' ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag ma spangs par khams gong ma las mi 'da' ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚Äúbecause they do not transcend the higher realms without abandoning those.‚Äù

original: kun du sbyor ba'i skabs rdzogs so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: kun du sbyor ba'i skabs rdzogs so zhes bya ba la /
translated: The section on the fetters is finished.

original: gang gi tshe rgyun du zhugs pas kun du sbyor ba gsum yongs su gtugs te spangs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di ni zhar la byung ba yin la /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rgyun du zhugs pas kun du sbyor ba gsum yongs su gtugs te spangs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di ni zhar la byung ba yin la /
translated: When it is said, ‚Äúbecause the stream-enterer has completely terminated and abandoned the three fetters,‚Äù this is a digression.

original: sgo dang rtsa ba bsdus phyir gsum //
analyzed: sgo dang rtsa ba bsdus phyir gsum //
translated: The root text says, ‚Äúbecause they include the doors and the roots,‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba 'di ni rgyu smras pa yin no //üîΩde dag kun du sbyor sogs kyis //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di ni rgyu smras pa yin no // de dag kun du sbyor sogs kyis //
translated: and this is the explanation of the cause.üîΩThey are also explained as five typesüîΩthrough the categories of fetters, and so on.

original: dbye bas yang rnam pa lngar bshad do zhes bya ba las kun du sbyor ba dag bshad zin to //
analyzed: dbye bas yang rnam pa lngar bshad do zhes bya ba las kun du sbyor ba dag bshad zin to //
translated: The fetters have been explained.

original: 'ching ba rnams gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'ching ba rnams gang zhe na /
translated: What are the bonds?

original: 'ching ba ni gsum ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'ching ba ni gsum ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: The root text says, ‚ÄúThere are three bonds.‚Äù

original: 'di rnams kyis 'ching bar byed pas na 'ching ba ste /
analyzed: 'di rnams kyis 'ching bar byed pas na 'ching ba ste /
translated: They are bonds because they bind.

original: 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gro ba la gegs byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gro ba la gegs byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of this is that they obstruct the attainment of freedom from attachment.

original: kun du sbyor ba dang 'ching ba rnams las mtshan nyid las tha dad pa ni yod pa ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: kun du sbyor ba dang 'ching ba rnams las mtshan nyid las tha dad pa ni yod pa ma yin mod kyi /
translated: However, there is no difference in characteristics from the fetters and bonds.

original: 'on kyang tshor ba'i dbang gis 'ching ba gsum du bshad do //
analyzed: 'on kyang tshor ba'i dbang gis 'ching ba gsum du bshad do //
translated: Nevertheless, the three bonds are explained by the power of feeling.üîΩAll attachment is a bond.

original: 'ching ba 'dod chags thams cad dang // zhes bya bas ni khams gsum pa rnam pa lnga char yang ngo zhes bya bar bstan to //
analyzed: 'ching ba 'dod chags thams cad dang // zhes bya bas ni khams gsum pa rnam pa lnga char yang ngo zhes bya bar bstan to //
translated: This shows that all five types in the three realms are bonds.

original: zhe sdang dang gti mug kyang ci rigs par de dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: zhe sdang dang gti mug kyang ci rigs par de dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o //
translated: Hatred and delusion should be understood in the same way, as appropriate.

original: sdug bsngal ni zhe sdang ngo //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ni zhe sdang ngo //
translated: Suffering is hatred.

original: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa la ni gti mug ste dmigs ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sgo nas zhes thams cad du yang dbang du bya bar sbyor ro //
analyzed: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa la ni gti mug ste dmigs ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sgo nas zhes thams cad du yang dbang du bya bar sbyor ro //
translated: In regard to neither-pleasure-nor-suffering, there is delusion. This is stated in terms of the object and concomitance. In all cases, it should be applied in terms of the power.

original: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dag ni de ltar ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dag ni de ltar ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Attachment and hatred are not like that.

original: bde ba la ji ltar 'dod chags rgyas par 'gyur ba de ltar zhe sdang la ma yin la /
analyzed: bde ba la ji ltar 'dod chags rgyas par 'gyur ba de ltar zhe sdang la ma yin la /
translated: As pleasure increases attachment, so hatred does not.

original: sdug bsngal la ji ltar zhe sdang rgyas par 'gyur ba de ltar 'dod chags la ma yin te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal la ji ltar zhe sdang rgyas par 'gyur ba de ltar 'dod chags la ma yin te /
translated: Attachment does not increase in relation to suffering to the extent that anger increases.

original: 'di ltar dgra'i bde ba dang sdug bsngal dag la zhe sdang dang 'dod chags dmigs pa'i sgo nas rgyas par 'gyur gyi /üîΩmtshungs par ldan pa'i sgo nas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar dgra'i bde ba dang sdug bsngal dag la zhe sdang dang 'dod chags dmigs pa'i sgo nas rgyas par 'gyur gyi / mtshungs par ldan pa'i sgo nas ni ma yin no //
translated: Anger and attachment increase in relation to the pleasure and pain of an enemy through the focal object, but not through concomitance.

original: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa la gti mug ji ltar rgyas pa de ltar 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dag ma yin gyi ;
analyzed: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa la gti mug ji ltar rgyas pa de ltar 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dag ma yin gyi ;
translated: How can delusion increase in relation to neither pleasure nor pain to the extent that attachment and anger do not?

original: rgyas par mi 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /üîΩgti mug ni mi gsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyas par mi 'gyur ba ni ma yin te / gti mug ni mi gsal ba'i phyir /
translated: But it is not that they do not increase.üîΩDelusion increases in relation to neither pleasure nor pain because it is unclear.

original: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa mi gsal ba kho na la rgyas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa mi gsal ba kho na la rgyas par 'gyur te /
translated: Attachment and anger do not increase in relation to neither pleasure nor pain because they are clear.

original: rjes su mthun pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rjes su mthun pa'i phyir te /
translated: Delusion increases in relation to that which is unclear because it is compatible with it.

original: thams cad btang snyoms dang mtshungs ldan //
analyzed: thams cad btang snyoms dang mtshungs ldan //
translated: All are concomitant with equanimity.

original: zhes 'chad pa'i phyir ro //üîΩyang na rang gi @133a * //
analyzed: zhes 'chad pa'i phyir ro //üîΩyang na rang gi @133a * //
translated: This is explained later.üîΩOr, attachment and anger do not increase in relation to neither pleasure nor pain because they are not generated in relation to it.

original: rgyud la yod pa'i dmigs pa'i sgo nas nges pa yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rgyud la yod pa'i dmigs pa'i sgo nas nges pa yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is determined by the object that exists in the stream of consciousness.

original: rang gi rgyud la yod pa'i bde ba la dmigs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sgo nas rgyas par 'gyur la /
analyzed: rang gi rgyud la yod pa'i bde ba la dmigs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sgo nas rgyas par 'gyur la /
translated: It increases by means of the object that exists in one's own stream of consciousness, through being associated with pleasure.

original: gzhan gyi rgyud la yod pa la ni dmigs pa tsam gyi sgo nas so //
analyzed: gzhan gyi rgyud la yod pa la ni dmigs pa tsam gyi sgo nas so //
translated: It increases by means of the object that exists in the stream of consciousness of another, through being merely the object.

original: zhe sdang la yang de bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: zhe sdang la yang de bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same should be said of hatred.

original: sems nye bar nyon mongs par byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sems nyon mongs pa can nyid du byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems nye bar nyon mongs par byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sems nyon mongs pa can nyid du byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they afflict the mind, means because they make the mind afflicted.

original: re zhig gang dag nyon mongs pa phra rgyas zhes bya ba gang yin pa de dag ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa yang yin te /
analyzed: re zhig gang dag nyon mongs pa phra rgyas zhes bya ba gang yin pa de dag ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa yang yin te /
translated: Those that are called afflictions and proclivities are also secondary afflictions.

original: de dag ni nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid tshang ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid tshang ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are complete in the characteristics of afflictions.

original: de dag ni kun du sbyor ba dang / 'ching ba dang / phra rgyas dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / kun nas dkris pa zhes bya ba yin pas de'i phyir de dag ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa yang yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni kun du sbyor ba dang / 'ching ba dang / phra rgyas dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / kun nas dkris pa zhes bya ba yin pas de'i phyir de dag ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa yang yin no //
translated: They are called fetters, bonds, latent afflictions, secondary afflictions, and entanglements. Therefore, they are also secondary afflictions.

original: gzhan zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa rnams las don gzhan gyi dngos por shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa rnams las don gzhan gyi dngos por shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Other means they should be understood as entities that are different from the afflictions.

original: nyon mongs pa can zhes bya ba ni dge ba dang / ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa bsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can zhes bya ba ni dge ba dang / ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa bsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Afflicted means excluding virtuous and unobscured indeterminate states.

original: sems byung zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang mi ldan pa bsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems byung zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang mi ldan pa bsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Mental factors means excluding form and the non-associated formative forces.

original: 'du byed phung zhes bya ba ni 'du shes dang tshor ba la sogs pa dag bsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'du byed phung zhes bya ba ni 'du shes dang tshor ba la sogs pa dag bsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Formative forces aggregate means excluding discernment, feeling, and so on.

original: de la nye ba'i nyon mongs pa kho na yin zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de la nye ba'i nyon mongs pa kho na yin zhes bya ba la /
translated: Among them, those that are only secondary afflictions are as follows.

original: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa ni nyon mongs pa dang nye bar 'dug pa dag go //
analyzed: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa ni nyon mongs pa dang nye bar 'dug pa dag go //
translated: Secondary afflictions are those that are close to the afflictions.

original: gzhi phran tshegs las byung ba gang dag yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni mi dga' ba dang / gla byed pa dang / sems zhum pa nyid dang / rmya ba dang / zas kyi drod mi zin pa la sogs pa dag go //
analyzed: gzhi phran tshegs las byung ba gang dag yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni mi dga' ba dang / gla byed pa dang / sems zhum pa nyid dang / rmya ba dang / zas kyi drod mi zin pa la sogs pa dag go //
translated: Those that occur in the Ksudraka Chapter are: disliking, being greedy, mental depression, emaciation, not digesting food, and so on.

original: 'dir ni kun nas dkris pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i dri mas bsdus pa kho na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'dir ni kun nas dkris pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i dri mas bsdus pa kho na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Here, only the entanglements and the defilement-stains are mentioned.

original: kun nas dkris pas bsdus pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i dri mas bsdus pa'o //üîΩde la 'di dag gis srid pa'i btson rar kun nas dkris pas na kun nas dkris pa dag yin pa'am /
analyzed: kun nas dkris pas bsdus pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i dri mas bsdus pa'o // de la 'di dag gis srid pa'i btson rar kun nas dkris pas na kun nas dkris pa dag yin pa'am /
translated: The entanglements are included in the entanglements and the defilement-stains are included in the defilement-stains.üîΩAmong them, these are entanglements because they entangle one in the prison of existence.

original: 'di dag yod na spyod pa ngan pa dag ldang bas na kun nas dkris pa dag go //
analyzed: 'di dag yod na spyod pa ngan pa dag ldang bas na kun nas dkris pa dag go //
translated: Or, they are entanglements because when they exist, bad conduct arises.

original: de la ngo tsha med pa dang khrel med pa ni bshad zin to zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la ngo tsha med pa dang khrel med pa ni bshad zin to zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Among them, shamelessness and lack of conscience have already been explained.

original: ma gus ngo tsha med khrel med //
analyzed: ma gus ngo tsha med khrel med //
translated: Disrespect is shamelessness and lack of conscience.

original: kha na ma tho 'jigs mi lta //üîΩzhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: kha na ma tho 'jigs mi lta //üîΩzhes bya ba yin no //
translated: One does not see faults in evil.

original: sems khong nas 'khrug pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sems khong nas 'khrug pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: Agitation means mental distress.

original: khong nas 'khrug pa ni gzhan gyi phun sum tshogs @133b pa la mi bzod pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyi sems kyi gdung ba'o //
analyzed: khong nas 'khrug pa ni gzhan gyi phun sum tshogs @133b pa la mi bzod pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyi sems kyi gdung ba'o //
translated: Agitation is mental distress preceded by intolerance of another's excellence.

original: ser sna ni zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ser sna ni zhes bya ba la /
translated: Stinginess means the state of being a miser.

original: gang las bdag las gzhan du ma 'gro zhig snyam par gyur pa de ni ser sna ste /
analyzed: gang las bdag las gzhan du ma 'gro zhig snyam par gyur pa de ni ser sna ste /
translated: Stinginess is the state of mind that thinks, May not go to another!

original: de'i dngos po ni ser sna nyid do //
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni ser sna nyid do //
translated: The state of being a miser is the nature of a miser.

original: chos dang zang zing dang mkhas pa rab tu 'byin pa dang / 'gal ba can zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chos dang zang zing dang mkhas pa rab tu 'byin pa dang / 'gal ba can zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The verse says the opposite of giving the Dharma, material goods, and skill,

original: chos rab tu sbyin pa dang 'gal ba can dang / zang zing rab tu sbyin pa dang 'gal ba can dang / mkhas pa rab tu sbyin pa dang 'gal ba can dang / sems kyi kun du 'dzin pa zhes bya ba la /üîΩsems kyi kun du 'dzin pa ni dngos po la mngon par zhen pa sngon du 'gro zhing /
analyzed: chos rab tu sbyin pa dang 'gal ba can dang / zang zing rab tu sbyin pa dang 'gal ba can dang / mkhas pa rab tu sbyin pa dang 'gal ba can dang / sems kyi kun du 'dzin pa zhes bya ba la / sems kyi kun du 'dzin pa ni dngos po la mngon par zhen pa sngon du 'gro zhing /
translated: The opposite of giving the Dharma, the opposite of giving material goods, the opposite of giving skill, and mental grasping.

original: de dang mi 'bral bar 'dod pa nyid do ;
analyzed: de dang mi 'bral bar 'dod pa nyid do ;
translated: Mental grasping is the desire not to be separated from an object, preceded by attachment to an object.üîΩThe state of being a miser is the nature of a miser.

original: / rgod pa ni sems rnam par ma zhi ba'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: / rgod pa ni sems rnam par ma zhi ba'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Excitement is a lack of mental tranquility.

original: glu dang gar dang sgeg pa'i cha lugs dang / rgyan gyis sems rnam par ma zhi ba dang / gang dang ldan pas lam gol bar zhugs par 'gyur ba de ni rgod pa'o //
analyzed: glu dang gar dang sgeg pa'i cha lugs dang / rgyan gyis sems rnam par ma zhi ba dang / gang dang ldan pas lam gol bar zhugs par 'gyur ba de ni rgod pa'o //
translated: It is a lack of mental tranquility due to singing, dancing, laughing, and wearing ornaments, by which one enters the wrong path.

original: 'gyod pa dang rmugs pa ni bshad zin to zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'gyod pa dang rmugs pa ni bshad zin to zhes bya ba la /
translated: Regret and lethargy have already been explained.

original: de la ni mdzod kyi gnas gnyis pa las /
analyzed: de la ni mdzod kyi gnas gnyis pa las /
translated: In this regard, the second chapter of the Abhidharmako≈õa states:üîΩRegret is a mental activity that torments the mind about what has been done.

original: ngan pa byas pa'i dngos po ni 'gyod pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / rmugs pa ni lus dang sems las su mi rung ba nyid do zhes bshad do //
analyzed: ngan pa byas pa'i dngos po ni 'gyod pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / rmugs pa ni lus dang sems las su mi rung ba nyid do zhes bshad do //
translated: Lethargy is unserviceability of body and mind.

original: gnyid ni sems mngon par sdud pa'o zhes brjod na ni snyoms par 'jug pa la yang thal bar 'gyur bas de'i phyir lus yang dag par 'dzin par mi nus pa'o zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: gnyid ni sems mngon par sdud pa'o zhes brjod na ni snyoms par 'jug pa la yang thal bar 'gyur bas de'i phyir lus yang dag par 'dzin par mi nus pa'o zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: If sleep is described as the complete withdrawal of mind and mental activities into the body, then it would follow that meditative attainment would also be sleep. Therefore, it is said to be the inability to properly maintain the body.

original: de ni nyon mongs pa can kho na kun nas dkris pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de ni nyon mongs pa can kho na kun nas dkris pa yin gyi /
translated: It is only a defiled entanglements.

original: dge ba 'am lung du ma bstan pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dge ba 'am lung du ma bstan pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not virtuous or indeterminate.

original: 'gyod pa yang nyon mongs pa can kho na kun nas dkris pa yin gyi dge ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'gyod pa yang nyon mongs pa can kho na kun nas dkris pa yin gyi dge ba ni ma yin no //
translated: Regret is also an entangle-ment only when it is defiled, not when it is virtuous.

original: khro ba ni gnod sems dang rnam par 'tshe ba ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba na de dag las gzhan pa sems can dang sems can ma yin pa dag la kun nas mnar sems pa ste /
analyzed: khro ba ni gnod sems dang rnam par 'tshe ba ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba na de dag las gzhan pa sems can dang sems can ma yin pa dag la kun nas mnar sems pa ste /
translated: Anger is hostility toward sentient beings and non-sentient things, except for malice and violence.

original: dper na dge slong bslab pa 'dod pa la sems 'khrug pa dang / tsher ma la sogs pa dag la 'khrug pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na dge slong bslab pa 'dod pa la sems 'khrug pa dang / tsher ma la sogs pa dag la 'khrug pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, a monk who desires training has hostility toward the agitation of the passions, and hostility toward thorns, etc.üîΩConcealment is the concealment of a moral offense.

original: 'chab pa ni kha na ma tho ba mkhyud pa'o zhes bya ba la kha na ma tho ba ni smad par bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'chab pa ni kha na ma tho ba mkhyud pa'o zhes bya ba la kha na ma tho ba ni smad par bya ba ste /
translated: Moral offenses are those that should be condemned.

original: tshul khrims dang / spyod pa dang / 'tsho ba rgud pa dag yin la /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang / spyod pa dang / 'tsho ba rgud pa dag yin la /
translated: They are the degeneration of morality, conduct, and livelihood.

original: mkhyud pa ni de sbed par 'dod pa'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: mkhyud pa ni de sbed par 'dod pa'i rgyu ste /
translated: Concealment is the cause of the desire to hide them.

original: sdig pa nang du gzhag pa'i phyir mi mngon par byed pa'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sdig pa nang du gzhag pa'i phyir mi mngon par byed pa'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the expression ‚Äúit is the non-manifestation of a moral offense‚Äù is that it is the internalization of a moral offense.

original: go rims bzhin du shes @134a * //
analyzed: go rims bzhin du shes @134a * //
translated: One should understand them in order.

original: pa dang mi shes pa rnams kyis yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: pa dang mi shes pa rnams kyis yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: respectively, by those who know and by those who do not know.üîΩThis is to be supplied with the words ‚Äúof those persons who conceal their faults.‚Äù

original: skyes bu gang zag 'chab pa dang ldan pa rnams kyi zhes bya bar sbyar te rgyal po la sogs pas shes pa rnams kyi ni bdag la rnyed pa dang / bkur sti med par 'gyur ro snyam du sred pa'i rgyu mthun pa yin no //
analyzed: skyes bu gang zag 'chab pa dang ldan pa rnams kyi zhes bya bar sbyar te rgyal po la sogs pas shes pa rnams kyi ni bdag la rnyed pa dang / bkur sti med par 'gyur ro snyam du sred pa'i rgyu mthun pa yin no //
translated: Those who are known to the king and so on fear that they will lose their wealth and honor.

original: mi shes pa rnams kyi ni ma rig pa'i rgyu mthun pa yin te /
analyzed: mi shes pa rnams kyi ni ma rig pa'i rgyu mthun pa yin te /
translated: Those who are not known fear that they will become known.

original: las bdag gir bya ba nyid du ma dad pa ni kha na ma tho ba 'chab kyi /

translated: Above that, all faculties of mental consciousness exist as appropriate.

original: de la bsam gtan gnyis pa na ni yid bde ba'i dbang po dang / btang snyoms kyi dbang po'o //
analyzed: de la bsam gtan gnyis pa na ni yid bde ba'i dbang po dang / btang snyoms kyi dbang po'o //
translated: In the second absorption, there is the faculty of mental satisfaction and the faculty of equanimity.

original: gsum pa na ni bde ba'i dbang po dang / btang snyoms kyi dbang po'o //
analyzed: gsum pa na ni bde ba'i dbang po dang / btang snyoms kyi dbang po'o //
translated: In the third absorption, there is the faculty of pleasure and the faculty of equanimity.

original: de yan chad na ni btang snyoms kyi dbang po kho na yod do //
analyzed: de yan chad na ni btang snyoms kyi dbang po kho na yod do //
translated: Above that, only the faculty of equanimity exists.

original: 'di dag skyo ba'i rnam par 'jug pa'i phyir dang / yid kyi sa pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni yid bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi dbang po bsal bar bya ba'i phyir khyad par gnyis so //
analyzed: 'di dag skyo ba'i rnam par 'jug pa'i phyir dang / yid kyi sa pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni yid bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi dbang po bsal bar bya ba'i phyir khyad par gnyis so //
translated: These two distinctions are made in order to exclude the faculties of mental pleasure and pain.

original: de dag dang rgyags pa zhes bya ba 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de dag dang rgyags pa zhes bya ba 'byung ngo //
translated: The text reads, and arrogance.

original: ji ltar rgyags pa yid kyi sa pa bde ba'i dbang po dang mtshungs par ldan zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar rgyags pa yid kyi sa pa bde ba'i dbang po dang mtshungs par ldan zhe na /
translated: How is it that arrogance is concomitant with the faculty of pleasure?

original: de'i phyir bsam gtan gsum pa na ni bde ba dang mtshungs par ldan no zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir bsam gtan gsum pa na ni bde ba dang mtshungs par ldan no zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, In the third meditative absorption, it is concomitant with pleasure.

original: ma rig pa bzhin du zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ma rig pa bzhin du zhes bya ba la /
translated: Like ignorance.

original: nyon mongs pa'am nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gang dang yang mtshungs par ldan pa bkag pa med pa de bzhin du btang snyoms kyang yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'am nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gang dang yang mtshungs par ldan pa bkag pa med pa de bzhin du btang snyoms kyang yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Just as ignorance is not excluded from being concomitant with any of the root or secondary mental afflictions, so too is equanimity.

original: mi dge ba'i sa mang po pa yin pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i sa mang po pa yin pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because it is a mental factor that is found in a variety of unwholesome states.

original: ngo tsha med pa dang / khrel med pa'o //
analyzed: ngo tsha med pa dang / khrel med pa'o //
translated: Shamelessness and lack of abashment.

original: nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because they are the universal mental factors of the root afflictions.

original: rmugs pa dang / rgod pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug la ni mi dge ba dang nyon mongs pa can srid pas @136a * //
analyzed: rmugs pa dang / rgod pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug la ni mi dge ba dang nyon mongs pa can srid pas @136a * //

analyzed: de'i phyir dbang po lnga char dang mtshungs par ldan te zhes bya ba smos so //

original: lnga gang zhe na /

analyzed: de la ci rmugs pa dang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni rmugs pa dang / rgod pa dang the tshom ni khams gsum pa yin la /

analyzed: 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang / gnod sems dag ni 'dod pa na spyod pa yin na /

analyzed: de las ni khyad par med par gsungs pas / ci rmugs pa dang rgod pa dang the tshom khams gsum pa gzung ngam /

analyzed: rmugs pa dang / rgod pa dang / bsres pa'i phyir dang / de dag kyang gcig tu nyon mongs pa can yin pa'i phyir ro //

original: rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang / rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa'i yang de bzhin du yin no //
analyzed: rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang / rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa'i yang de bzhin du yin no //
translated: The same applies to torpor, sleep, excitation, and regret.

translated: Calming is the meaning of one-pointedness of mind and concentration.üîΩDesire for pleasure and malice harm the aggregate of morality.

analyzed: rtog pa 'di lta na ni zhes bya ba ni gal te rmugs pa dang gnyid shes rab kyi phung po dang / 'gal ba nyid du rtog cing /
translated: If one conceives of lethargy and sleep as being adverse to the aggregate of wisdom,

original: rgod pa dang 'gyod pa ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po dang 'gal bar rtog na ni /
analyzed: rgod pa dang 'gyod pa ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po dang 'gal bar rtog na ni /
translated: and if one conceives of excited speech and regret as being adverse to the aggregate of meditative concentration,

original: de lta yin dang rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa'i sgrib pa rmugs pa dang gnyid kyis sgrib pa'i sngar smos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin dang rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa'i sgrib pa rmugs pa dang gnyid kyis sgrib pa'i sngar smos par 'gyur ro //
translated: then the obscurations of excited speech and regret would be mentioned before the obscurations of lethargy and sleep.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na ;
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na ;
translated: Why is this?

original: 'di ltar rim pa gang gis tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab kyi phung po dag bstan pa'i rim pa des de dag gis mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa'i sgrib pa rnams kyi bstan par rigs te /

translated: Because it is proper to teach the obscurations that are adverse to the aggregates of morality, meditative concentration, and wisdom in the same order in which those aggregates are taught.

original: rim pa las rgal ba la dgos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rim pa las rgal ba la dgos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no need to disrupt the sequence.

original: grangs bzhin du zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: grangs bzhin du zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In accordance with the enumeration,

original: rmugs pa dang / gnyid ni ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: rmugs pa dang / gnyid ni ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: lethargy and sleep are secondary afflictions of the aggregate of meditative concentration.

original: rgod pa dang 'gyod pa ni shes rab kyi phung po'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa ste /
analyzed: rgod pa dang 'gyod pa ni shes rab kyi phung po'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa ste /
translated: Excitement and regret are the secondary defilements of the aggregate of wisdom.

original: 'di ltar ting nge 'dzin la brtson pa ni rmugs pa dang gnyid kyi 'jigs pa la chos rab tu 'byed pa la brtson pa ni rgod pa dang 'gyod pas 'jigs so //
analyzed: 'di ltar ting nge 'dzin la brtson pa ni rmugs pa dang gnyid kyi 'jigs pa la chos rab tu 'byed pa la brtson pa ni rgod pa dang 'gyod pas 'jigs so //
translated: Thus, one who is striving in meditative concentration is afraid of torpor and sleep, and one who is striving in the discernment of what is in conformity with the truths is afraid of excitement and regret.

original: rgyu bar 'gyur bas zhes bya ba ni bsod snyoms kyi ched du 'byam pas so //
analyzed: rgyu bar 'gyur bas zhes bya ba ni bsod snyoms kyi ched du 'byam pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúIn motion‚Äù means in the process of wandering about for the sake of alms.

original: gnas par gyur pa'i zhes bya ba ni nang du yang dag 'jog par 'dug pa'am 'chag pa'i'o //
analyzed: gnas par gyur pa'i zhes bya ba ni nang du yang dag 'jog par 'dug pa'am 'chag pa'i'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn a settled condition‚Äù means either sitting or walking in solitude.

original: de'i mngon du 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni sdug pa dang mi sdug pa'i mtshan ma mngon du 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: de'i mngon du 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni sdug pa dang mi sdug pa'i mtshan ma mngon du 'gro ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn the presence of‚Äù means in the presence of signs of the attractive and the unattractive.

original: de'i 'og tu ting nge 'dzin du zhugs pas zhes bya @137a * //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu ting nge 'dzin du zhugs pas zhes bya @137a * //
translated: After that, one who has entered meditative concentration,

original: ba 'dir ma rig pa ni zhi gnas kyi rgyu mtshan dang lhag mthong gi rgyu mtshan phyin ci log tu yid la byed pa 'di yin no //
analyzed: ba 'dir ma rig pa ni zhi gnas kyi rgyu mtshan dang lhag mthong gi rgyu mtshan phyin ci log tu yid la byed pa 'di yin no //
translated: ignorance here is the incorrect mental attention to the causal signs of calm abiding and the causal signs of insight.

original: go rims bzhin du zhes bya ba ni rmugs pa dang / gnyid ni zhi gnas kyi bar chad byed la /
analyzed: go rims bzhin du zhes bya ba ni rmugs pa dang / gnyid ni zhi gnas kyi bar chad byed la /
translated: The phrase in order means that lethargy and sleep hinder serenity.

original: rgod pa dang 'gyod pa ni lhag mthong gi bar chad byed de /
analyzed: rgod pa dang 'gyod pa ni lhag mthong gi bar chad byed de /
translated: Excitement and regret hinder insight.

original: rlung dmar gyis dkrugs pa'i chu la gzugs kyi gzugs brnyan mi snang ba ltar /
analyzed: rlung dmar gyis dkrugs pa'i chu la gzugs kyi gzugs brnyan mi snang ba ltar /
translated: Just as a reflection does not appear in water disturbed by wind,

original: rgod pa dang 'gyod pas dkrugs pa'i sems la de nyid mthong ba med do //
analyzed: rgod pa dang 'gyod pas dkrugs pa'i sems la de nyid mthong ba med do //
translated: the truth is not seen in a mind disturbed by excitement and regret.

original: the tshom gyis kyang de nyid mthong bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: the tshom gyis kyang de nyid mthong bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The truth is also not seen due to doubt.

analyzed: skal ba mi mnyam pa'i khams kun du 'gro ba rnams kyi dmigs pa ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams dag yin zhing /

analyzed: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dag gis yongs su shes par bya ba yin la /
translated: They are objects to be abandoned by the perseverance for subsequent knowledge of the truths of suffering and origin.

original: de rnams de'i tshe spong ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de rnams de'i tshe spong ba ni ma yin te /
translated: But they are not objects to be abandoned at that time.

original: sngar spangs zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngar spangs zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are previously abandoned.

original: de rnams ni sngar sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung la chos shes pa'i dus su spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams ni sngar sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung la chos shes pa'i dus su spangs pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: 'gog pa dang lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba zag pa dang bcas pa la dmigs pa rnams kyi dmigs pa ni 'gog pa dang lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba log par lta ba la sogs pa yin la /
translated: to be abandoned by seeing the truths of cessation and path.

original: log par lta ba la sogs pa de dag kyang sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung gis bsdus pa'i phyir /
analyzed: log par lta ba la sogs pa de dag kyang sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung gis bsdus pa'i phyir /
