translated: The sutra states:

original: skye ba na yang sdug bsngal zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir 'di de'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba na yang sdug bsngal zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir 'di de'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúWhen it arises, it is suffering‚Äù because that is its nature.

original: 'gyur ba na ni bde ste /
analyzed: 'gyur ba na ni bde ste /
translated: When it changes, it is suffering.

original: gang gi phyir de gyur pas bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa yang bde ba skyes pa ltar snang ngo //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de gyur pas bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa yang bde ba skyes pa ltar snang ngo //
translated: Because of that, the neither-pleasure-nor-pain is also like the appearance of the arising of pleasure.

original: 'dir 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal ni bde ba rgyun chad pa yin la rgyun chad pa yang 'dod pa'i khams na dus nyung zad pa yin la /
analyzed: 'dir 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal ni bde ba rgyun chad pa yin la rgyun chad pa yang 'dod pa'i khams na dus nyung zad pa yin la /
translated: Here, the suffering of change is the cessation of pleasure. The cessation of pleasure is for a short time in the desire realm.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams dag na ni phul du byung bar yod cing nyes pa zad pa rnams la ni gtan du @148b ba'o ;
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams dag na ni phul du byung bar yod cing nyes pa zad pa rnams la ni gtan du @148b ba'o ;
translated: In the form and formless realms, it is excellent. For those who have exhausted faults, it is permanent.

original: /'du byed kho nas sdug bsngal ba nyid de zhes bya ba ni skye ba kho nas sdug bsngal ba nyid do //
analyzed: /'du byed kho nas sdug bsngal ba nyid de zhes bya ba ni skye ba kho nas sdug bsngal ba nyid do //
translated: Only formations are suffering means that only arising is suffering.

original: de myong bar 'gyur ba'i 'du byed rnams kyang tshor ba dang 'dra bar brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de myong bar 'gyur ba'i 'du byed rnams kyang tshor ba dang 'dra bar brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The formations that are to be experienced as pleasure should be stated to be like feeling.

original: bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i 'du byed rnams ni sdug bsngal gyi rang bzhin gyis tshor ba ltar 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal gyis sdug bsngal ba nyid de /
analyzed: bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i 'du byed rnams ni sdug bsngal gyi rang bzhin gyis tshor ba ltar 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal gyis sdug bsngal ba nyid de /
translated: The formations that are to be experienced as pleasure are suffering due to the suffering of change, like the feeling of the nature of suffering.

original: gzhan dag la yang de dang 'dra bar brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag la yang de dang 'dra bar brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same should be said of the other two.

original: thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Because they are not shared in common, etc.

original: sdug bsngal ni rang gi ngo bo kho nas mi mthun pa yin gyi /üîΩ'gyur bas ma yin la bde ba yang 'gyur bas mi mthun pa yin gyi ;
analyzed: sdug bsngal ni rang gi ngo bo kho nas mi mthun pa yin gyi / 'gyur bas ma yin la bde ba yang 'gyur bas mi mthun pa yin gyi ;
translated: Suffering is disagreeable by its very nature, not by its transformation.

original: rang gi ngo bos ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bos ni ma yin te /
translated: Pleasure is disagreeable by its transformation, not by its very nature.

original: di'i phyir 'gyur ba dang sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal dag ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal rnams kyi thun mong ma yin no //
analyzed: di'i phyir 'gyur ba dang sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal dag ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal rnams kyi thun mong ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the suffering of transformation and the suffering of pain are not shared in common by pleasure and suffering.üîΩAll formations are suffering because of the suffering of the formations themselves.

original: 'du byed thams cad ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni yid du 'ong ba la sogs pa 'du byed thams cad ni 'dus byas yin pa nyid kyis mi mthun pa yin pas 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid kyis sdug bsngal ba yin no
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni yid du 'ong ba la sogs pa 'du byed thams cad ni 'dus byas yin pa nyid kyis mi mthun pa yin pas 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid kyis sdug bsngal ba yin no
translated: All formations, whether pleasant, unpleasant, or neither, are disagreeable because they are conditioned, and thus they are suffering because of the suffering of the formations themselves.

original: zhes bya'o // de lta na 'o na 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid kyis 'du byed la khyab pa'i phyir thams cad srid pa thams cad dang mi mthun par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // de lta na 'o na 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid kyis 'du byed la khyab pa'i phyir thams cad srid pa thams cad dang mi mthun par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Thus, since the suffering of conditioned existence pervades all conditioned states, it follows that all conditioned states are disagreeable to all ƒÅryas.

original: de'i phyir de dag kyang 'phags pa rnams kho nas gzigs so zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag kyang 'phags pa rnams kho nas gzigs so zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that only the ƒÅryas perceive these conditioned states.

original: 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal dag go //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal dag go //
translated: These are the conditioned states that are the suffering of the third type.

original: byis pa sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal nyid kyis rtsub par byas pa rnams kyis ni de dag mi rtogs te /
analyzed: byis pa sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal nyid kyis rtsub par byas pa rnams kyis ni de dag mi rtogs te /
translated: Fools do not understand these conditioned states because they are coarsened by the suffering of suffering.

original: de'i phyir thams cad srid pa thams cad dang mi mthun pa nyid du thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir thams cad srid pa thams cad dang mi mthun pa nyid du thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it does not follow that all conditioned states are disagreeable to all ƒÅryas.

original: sdug bsngal thams cad zad par 'dren pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal thams cad zad par 'dren pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because it leads to the complete destruction of all suffering.

original: 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis kyang sdug bsngal zad par 'dren mod kyi /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis kyang sdug bsngal zad par 'dren mod kyi /
translated: The mundane path also leads to the complete destruction of suffering.

original: sdug bsngal thams cad zad par 'dren pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal thams cad zad par 'dren pa ma yin te /
translated: However, it does not lead to the complete destruction of all suffering.

original: des srid pa'i rtse mo las 'dod chags dang bral ba mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des srid pa'i rtse mo las 'dod chags dang bral ba mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is impossible to be free from attachment to the summit of existence.

original: gal te lam sdug bsngal ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te lam sdug bsngal ma yin na /
translated: If the path is not suffering,

original: 'o na ji ltar de dag gis 'dus byas thams cad 'gag pa la zhi bar mthong zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar de dag gis 'dus byas thams cad 'gag pa la zhi bar mthong zhe na /
translated: then how do they see the cessation of all conditioned things as peace?

original: de'i phyir gang gi tshe de dag mya ngan las 'das pa la zhi bar lta ba de'i tshe yang zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang gi tshe de dag mya ngan las 'das pa la zhi bar lta ba de'i tshe yang zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore he says, ‚ÄúWhen they view nirvana as peace,‚Äù

original: sdug bsngal du mthong ba 'gags pa la zhi ba'i blo rung gi gzhan la ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal du mthong ba 'gags pa la zhi ba'i blo rung gi gzhan la ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: it is suitable to have the idea that cessation is peace when seeing suffering, but not otherwise.

original: sdug bsngal du mthong ba @149a * //
analyzed: sdug bsngal du mthong ba @149a * //
translated: What is seen as suffering?

original: gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po ste /
analyzed: gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po ste /
translated: It is contaminated things.

original: de kho na 'gags pa la zhi bar lta'i lam ni ma yin no zhes khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: de kho na 'gags pa la zhi bar lta'i lam ni ma yin no zhes khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that only their cessation is seen as peace, not the path.

original: mon sran sde'u la sogs pa yod bzhin du mon sran gre'u phung po zhes ston pa bzhin te zhes bya ba 'jig rten na mon sran gre'u'i phung po ni nang na mon sran sde'u dang / sran chung dang / sran ma la sogs pa yod bzhin du yang nyung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mon sran sde'u la sogs pa yod bzhin du mon sran gre'u phung po zhes ston pa bzhin te zhes bya ba 'jig rten na mon sran gre'u'i phung po ni nang na mon sran sde'u dang / sran chung dang / sran ma la sogs pa yod bzhin du yang nyung ba'i phyir /
translated: It is like the expression ‚Äúa heap of beans‚Äù when there are peas, etc., in the heap.üîΩIn the world, a heap of beans is a collection of peas, lentils, and beans, etc.

original: mon sran sde'u la sogs pa la mon sran gre'u'i phung po zhes tha snyad 'dogs pa snang ba de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: mon sran sde'u la sogs pa la mon sran gre'u'i phung po zhes tha snyad 'dogs pa snang ba de dang 'dra'o //
translated: Even though there are peas, etc., in the heap, the expression ‚Äúa heap of beans‚Äù is used because the beans are predominant.

original: chus btab pa'i bde ba chung ngus zhes bya ba ni chus btab pa'i bde ba nyung zad kyis so //
analyzed: chus btab pa'i bde ba chung ngus zhes bya ba ni chus btab pa'i bde ba nyung zad kyis so //
translated: The expression ‚Äúa heap of beans‚Äù is used because the pleasure of being sprinkled with water is slight.

original: yang smras pa zhes bya ba ni slob dpon dpal len nyid do //
analyzed: yang smras pa zhes bya ba ni slob dpon dpal len nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúAgain, it is said‚Äù refers to the master ≈örƒ´lƒÅta himself.

original: sdug bsngal gyi ni rgyu phyir dang // zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ba'i las dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir sdug bsngal gyi rgyu'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi ni rgyu phyir dang // zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ba'i las dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir sdug bsngal gyi rgyu'o //
translated: Because it is the cause of suffering means that it is the cause of suffering because it is concomitant with the karma that will experience suffering.

original: sdug bsngal mang po bskyed phyir dang // zhes bya ba ni yul tshol ba'i ngal ba'i sdug bsngal dag gis so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal mang po bskyed phyir dang // zhes bya ba ni yul tshol ba'i ngal ba'i sdug bsngal dag gis so //
translated: This refers to the sufferings of the fatigue of searching for objects.

original: sdug bsngal yod na de 'dod phyir //
analyzed: sdug bsngal yod na de 'dod phyir //
translated: If there is suffering, there is a desire for that.

original: zhes bya ba ni bkres pa dang skom pa la sogs pa yod na ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bkres pa dang skom pa la sogs pa yod na ste /
translated: This refers to the existence of hunger, thirst, etc.

original: zas dang skom la sogs pa'i bden pa ni 'phags pa rnams kyis sdug bsngal du rtogs so //
analyzed: zas dang skom la sogs pa'i bden pa ni 'phags pa rnams kyis sdug bsngal du rtogs so //
translated: The truth of food and drink, etc. is understood as suffering by the noble ones.

original: 'phags pa rnams kyis sdug bsngal du gzigs te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyis sdug bsngal du gzigs te zhes bya ba la /
translated: The noble ones see it as suffering.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal du ro gcig pas zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal du ro gcig pas zhes 'byung ste /
translated: Because it is of the same taste as the suffering of the formative forces.

original: 'du byed la sogs pa yod na ste /
analyzed: 'du byed la sogs pa yod na ste /
translated: If there are formative forces, etc.

original: zas dang skom gyi sdug bsngal du rnam pa gcig pas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zas dang skom gyi sdug bsngal du rnam pa gcig pas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means that the suffering of food and drink, etc. is of the same aspect.

original: mi rtag pa'i mtshan nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa'i rnam pas mi mthun pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i mtshan nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa'i rnam pas mi mthun pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: By the characteristic of impermanence. This means that it is not in harmony with the aspect of impermanence. This is the meaning.

original: dper na gzugs dang 'du shes la sogs pa la yang zhes bya ba ni dper na gzugs dang 'du shes dang rnam par shes pa la sogs pa rnams kyang mi rtag pa nyid kyis mi mthun pa'i phyir sdug bsngal du lta ba de bzhin du bde ba'i tshorüîΩba yang yin no //
analyzed: dper na gzugs dang 'du shes la sogs pa la yang zhes bya ba ni dper na gzugs dang 'du shes dang rnam par shes pa la sogs pa rnams kyang mi rtag pa nyid kyis mi mthun pa'i phyir sdug bsngal du lta ba de bzhin du bde ba'i tshor ba yang yin no //
translated: Just as the feeling of pain is viewed as suffering, so also are the feelings of pleasure and neither pleasure nor pain.

original: de dag ji ltar sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba bzhin du sdug bsngal ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag ji ltar sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba bzhin du sdug bsngal ba ni ma yin te /
translated: But they are not suffering in the same way as the feeling of pain.

original: 'o na ci zhe na mi rtag pa nyid kyis mi mthun pa'i phyir sdug bsngal du lta ba yin no //
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na mi rtag pa nyid kyis mi mthun pa'i phyir sdug bsngal du lta ba yin no //
translated: Rather, they are viewed as suffering because they are impermanent and disharmonious.

original: gang zhig ces bya ba ni slob dpon gnas brtan gzhon nu len la smras pa'o //üîΩde'i de ni kun 'byung gi rnam pa yin gyi /üîΩ@149b sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa ni ma yin te /üîΩde ni kun 'byung gi bden pa kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: gang zhig ces bya ba ni slob dpon gnas brtan gzhon nu len la smras pa'o // de'i de ni kun 'byung gi rnam pa yin gyi / @149b sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa ni ma yin te / de ni kun 'byung gi bden pa kho na yin gyi /
translated: The elder Revata said to the master:üîΩ‚ÄúThat is the aspect of origination, not the aspect of suffering.

original: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ni ma yin no //
translated: For that is the truth of origination, not the truth of suffering.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med par skyes pa dag gis 'phags pa rnams la yang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med par skyes pa dag gis 'phags pa rnams la yang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: and those born in the form and formless realms, also have the perception of suffering.

original: gal te sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir sdug bsngal gyi 'du shes 'jug na /
analyzed: gal te sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir sdug bsngal gyi 'du shes 'jug na /
translated: If the perception of suffering occurs because form is the cause of suffering,

original: mtshan nyid 'di ma khyab pa yin no //üîΩde nyid kyi phyir de dag gi zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: mtshan nyid 'di ma khyab pa yin no // de nyid kyi phyir de dag gi zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: then this definition is not universal.

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i gzugs dang gzugs med par skyes pa dag gis phung po rnams ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i gzugs dang gzugs med par skyes pa dag gis phung po rnams ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyu ma yin te /
translated: Therefore it is said, ‚Äúbecause of that, those nonreturners born in the form and formless realms do not have the perception of suffering.‚ÄùüîΩThe aggregates are not the cause of suffering because they attain nirvana in that very lifetime.

original: de nyid du yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i phyir phung po rnams dmyal ba la sogs pa'i rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid du yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i phyir phung po rnams dmyal ba la sogs pa'i rgyu ma yin no //
translated: The aggregates are not the cause of hell and so on.

original: de'i phyir de dag sdug bsngal gyi blo mi 'jug pa zhig na de ni 'dod pa spang ba yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag sdug bsngal gyi blo mi 'jug pa zhig na de ni 'dod pa spang ba yin te /
translated: Therefore, if the perception of suffering does not occur for them, then that is the abandonment of desire.

original: 'phags pa rnams kyis khams gsum pa'i phung po rnams kyang sdug bsngal du mi gzigs so //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyis khams gsum pa'i phung po rnams kyang sdug bsngal du mi gzigs so //
translated: Aryas do not view the aggregates of the three realms as suffering.

original: mdo las / 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: mdo las / 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: The nature of the suffering of conditioned states.

original: gal te sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir bde ba yang sdug bsngal lta bu'i mi rtag pa nyid kyi phyir ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir bde ba yang sdug bsngal lta bu'i mi rtag pa nyid kyi phyir ma yin na /
translated: If pleasure is not impermanent like suffering because it is the cause of suffering,

original: de lta na ni 'o na 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid bstan pa don med do //
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid bstan pa don med do //
translated: then it is pointless to teach the nature of the suffering of conditioned states.

original: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin par smra ba de nyid kyis /üîΩgal te mi rtag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba rgyas par smras te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin par smra ba de nyid kyis / gal te mi rtag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba rgyas par smras te /
translated: If you say that pleasure is the cause of suffering,üîΩthen it is pointless to teach the nature of the suffering of conditioned states.

original: gal te mi rtag pa'i phyir sdug bsngal lta bu'i sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te mi rtag pa'i phyir sdug bsngal lta bu'i sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ma yin na /
translated: If pleasure is not impermanent like suffering because it is the cause of suffering,üîΩthen what is the difference between the aspects of impermanence and suffering?

original: 'o na mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa dag la khyad par ci yod de yod pa ma yin pa nyid do snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: 'o na mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa dag la khyad par ci yod de yod pa ma yin pa nyid do snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: There is no difference.üîΩThe Master says:

original: 'di la slob dpon gyis skye zhing 'jig pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir mi rtag par lta la zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'di la slob dpon gyis skye zhing 'jig pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir mi rtag par lta la zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Because it is subject to arising and disintegration, it is viewed as impermanent.

original: rtag pa yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the permanent does not exist.

original: mi mthun pa yin pa'i phyir sdug bsngal du zhes bya ba 'di mi 'dod pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mi mthun pa yin pa'i phyir sdug bsngal du zhes bya ba 'di mi 'dod pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because it is disagreeable, it is suffering. This is because it is not desired.

original: ji ltar mi mthun pa yin pa'i phyir sdug bsngal yin pa de ltar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ji ltar mi mthun pa yin pa'i phyir sdug bsngal yin pa de ltar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate how it is suffering because it is disagreeable, he says:

original: mi rtag par mthong na mi mthun par gyur pas mi rtag pa'i rnam pas sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa 'dren par byed do zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: mi rtag par mthong na mi mthun par gyur pas mi rtag pa'i rnam pas sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa 'dren par byed do zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: When one sees it as impermanent, it becomes disagreeable. Thus, the aspect of suffering is induced by the aspect of impermanence.

original: mi rtag pa nyid kyis mi mthun pa yin pa'i phyir de skad du bshad kyi /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid kyis mi mthun pa yin pa'i phyir de skad du bshad kyi /
translated: This is stated because it is disagreeable due to impermanence.

original: mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa dag la khyad par med pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //üîΩlam gyi @150a * //
analyzed: mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa dag la khyad par med pa'i phyir ni ma yin no // lam gyi @150a * //
translated: But it is not because there is no difference between the aspects of impermanence and suffering.

original: bden pa la mi rtag pa'i rnam pas sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa ji ltar mi 'dren ce na /
analyzed: bden pa la mi rtag pa'i rnam pas sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa ji ltar mi 'dren ce na /
translated: How is the aspect of suffering not induced by the aspect of the path?

original: 'di ltar sdug bsngal gyi bden pa kho na mi rtag pa'i rnam pas sun 'byin par byed kyi lam gyi bden pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar sdug bsngal gyi bden pa kho na mi rtag pa'i rnam pas sun 'byin par byed kyi lam gyi bden pas ni ma yin no //
translated: Thus, he repudiates only the truth of suffering as impermanent, not the truth of the path.

original: sun 'byin par mi byed par ga las she na /
analyzed: sun 'byin par mi byed par ga las she na /
translated: Why does he not repudiate the latter?

original: yon tan du mthong ba'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: yon tan du mthong ba'i phyir ro ;
translated: Because he sees it as a good quality.

original: / kha cig na re zhes bya ba ni btsun pa dpal len la sogs pa dag go //
analyzed: / kha cig na re zhes bya ba ni btsun pa dpal len la sogs pa dag go //

analyzed: rnam par 'gyur ba dang mi rtag pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rnam par 'gyur ba'i chos can yin pa'i phyir dang / mi rtag pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir dang / rnam par 'gyur ba ni gzhan du 'gyur ba yin la / gzhan du 'gyur ba ni de ma thag tu sdug bsngal lam bde ba yang ma yin /
translated: Because they are subject to transformation and impermanence means that they are subject to transformation because they are impermanent. Transformation is a change.

original: sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba 'byung ba'o //
translated: A change is the arising of a feeling that is either pleasant, unpleasant, or neither pleasant nor unpleasant.

original: de'i ro myong bar byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bde ba'i tshor ba'i ro myong bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i ro myong bar byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bde ba'i tshor ba'i ro myong bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they experience the taste of that means that they experience the taste of pleasant feeling.

original: de la 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bde ba'i tshor ba la 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bde ba'i tshor ba la 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one is free from attachment to it means because one is free from attachment to the feeling of pleasure.

original: de'i rang gi ngo bos bde zhes bya ba 'di ji ltar khong du chud ce na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de'i rang gi ngo bos bde zhes bya ba 'di ji ltar khong du chud ce na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: It is like this.

original: gal te tshor ba bde ba yang rang gi ngo bos ma yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te tshor ba bde ba yang rang gi ngo bos ma yin na ni /
translated: If the feeling of pleasure is not by its intrinsic nature,

original: des na sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal kho nas sdug bsngal du ston par 'gyur gyi 'du byed dang rnam par 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal dag gis ston par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal kho nas sdug bsngal du ston par 'gyur gyi 'du byed dang rnam par 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal dag gis ston par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then it would be shown to be suffering only by the suffering of suffering, and not by the suffering of the formations and the suffering of change.

original: 'dod pa'i yon tan rnams zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i yul rnams so //üîΩskye ba la zhes bya ba ni bder 'gror ram /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i yon tan rnams zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i yul rnams so // skye ba la zhes bya ba ni bder 'gror ram /

original: sa srungs kyi du la sogs pa ngan 'gror skye ba la'o //
analyzed: sa srungs kyi du la sogs pa ngan 'gror skye ba la'o //
translated: In birth means in birth in a happy realm or in a miserable realm such as the hells.üîΩIn birth, it is the same.

original: skye ba la yang de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba la ci zhig na /
analyzed: skye ba la yang de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba la ci zhig na /
translated: What is the same?

original: sdug bsngal ni mang ba yin na /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ni mang ba yin na /
translated: If suffering is the most abundant,

original: gcig tu bde bar lta ba ni phyin ci log pa ni yin te zhes skabs dang sbyar ro //üîΩyon @152a * //
analyzed: gcig tu bde bar lta ba ni phyin ci log pa ni yin te zhes skabs dang sbyar ro // yon @152a * //
translated: to view it as exclusively pleasure is an error.üîΩWhat is the advantage?

original: tan ci zhig yod par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba gsungs pas yon tan ci zhig thob ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: tan ci zhig yod par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba gsungs pas yon tan ci zhig thob ces bya ba'o //
translated: What is the advantage of teaching the three feelings of pleasure, suffering and neither pleasure nor suffering?

original: gal te 'jig rten dang mthun par gsungs pa yin no zhe na ste /
analyzed: gal te 'jig rten dang mthun par gsungs pa yin no zhe na ste /
translated: If you say that the Buddha taught in accordance with worldly convention,

original: 'jig rten dang mthun par tshor ba gsungs so snyam pa'i blo 'dir 'gyur na'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten dang mthun par tshor ba gsungs so snyam pa'i blo 'dir 'gyur na'o //
translated: then the idea would be that he taught the three feelings in accordance with worldly convention.

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: But that is not so,

original: tshor ba thams cad sdug bsngal ba nyid ni dgongs nas gsungs so zhes bka' stsal pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshor ba thams cad sdug bsngal ba nyid ni dgongs nas gsungs so zhes bka' stsal pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the Buddha declared that he taught the three feelings with the intention of teaching that all feelings are suffering.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: kun dga' bo gang ci tshor yang rung de ni 'dir sdug bsngal lo zhes bya ba ni ngas 'du byed mi rtag pa nyid dang ; 'du byed rnam par 'gyur ba nyid la dgongs nas gsungs so zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: kun dga' bo gang ci tshor yang rung de ni 'dir sdug bsngal lo zhes bya ba ni ngas 'du byed mi rtag pa nyid dang ; 'du byed rnam par 'gyur ba nyid la dgongs nas gsungs so zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWhatever is felt is suffering here‚Äù was stated by me with the intention of conditioned states being impermanent and conditioned states changing.

original: de'i phyir 'jig rten dang mthun par tshor ba gsum zhes gsungs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'jig rten dang mthun par tshor ba gsum zhes gsungs pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, the three feelings are not stated in accordance with the world.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kho nas tshor ba gsum yod do //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kho nas tshor ba gsum yod do //
translated: The three feelings exist by their own characteristics.

original: gzhan yang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin zhes gsungs pa'i yang phyir tshor ba gsum don dam pa kho nar yod kyi 'jig rten dang mthun par ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin zhes gsungs pa'i yang phyir tshor ba gsum don dam pa kho nar yod kyi 'jig rten dang mthun par ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, the three feelings exist ultimately, not in accordance with the world, because it is stated, ‚Äúin reality.‚Äù

original: yang ji ltar yang dag pa ji lta ba gsungs she na /üîΩbde ba'i dbang po gang yin pa dang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: yang ji ltar yang dag pa ji lta ba gsungs she na /üîΩbde ba'i dbang po gang yin pa dang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: How is it stated in reality?üîΩThe eye faculty and the faculties from the eye faculty up to the mind faculty are the seven that are said to be pure.

original: 'dir dper brjod pa ni de ltar yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin mthong zhing zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: 'dir dper brjod pa ni de ltar yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin mthong zhing zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
translated: The example here is ‚Äúthus, one sees reality just as it is through right wisdom.‚Äù

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin ni sgro ma btags pa dang skur pa ma btab pa la brjod na /
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin ni sgro ma btags pa dang skur pa ma btab pa la brjod na /
translated: If ‚Äújust as it is‚Äù refers to what is not exaggerated and what is not denigrated,

original: gal te sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba tsam kho na zhig yin na ni sdug bsngal bde bar mthong ba yang dag pa ji lta ba yin par ji ltar rigs /
analyzed: gal te sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba tsam kho na zhig yin na ni sdug bsngal bde bar mthong ba yang dag pa ji lta ba yin par ji ltar rigs /
translated: then how could it be right to say that the seeing of the suffering of pain as pleasure is ‚Äújust as it is‚Äù?

original: 'jig rten yang ji ltar na sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba la rnam pa gsum du rtogs par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'jig rten yang ji ltar na sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba la rnam pa gsum du rtogs par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni /
translated: And how could the world understand the three aspects of the suffering of pain?

original: gal te tshor ba rnam pa gsum ma yin na snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: gal te tshor ba rnam pa gsum ma yin na snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: The idea is that if there were not three kinds of feeling,

original: gal te chung ngu dang / chen po dang / 'bring po dag la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: gal te chung ngu dang / chen po dang / 'bring po dag la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: If it is said that the three aspects are small, large, and medium,

original: sdug bsngal chung ngu la ni bde ba'i blo'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal chung ngu la ni bde ba'i blo'o //
translated: then the small suffering of pain is pleasant,

original: chen po la ni sdug bsngal gyi blo'o //
analyzed: chen po la ni sdug bsngal gyi blo'o //
translated: the large is suffering,üîΩand the medium is neither pleasant nor suffering.

original: 'bring la ni bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i blo'o //
analyzed: 'bring la ni bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i blo'o //
translated: The middle is the idea of neither pleasure nor pain.üîΩSince pleasure is threefold, the idea of pain arises even in regard to pleasure.

original: bde ba la rnam pa gsum yod pas zhes bya ba la ji ltar tshor ba sdug bsngal rnam pa gsum dmigs pa de bzhin du bde ba yang dmigs pas bde ba la yang sdug bsngal gyi blor 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bde ba la rnam pa gsum yod pas zhes bya ba la ji ltar tshor ba sdug bsngal rnam pa gsum dmigs pa de bzhin du bde ba yang dmigs pas bde ba la yang sdug bsngal gyi blor 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as the idea of pain is observed in three ways in regard to the feeling of pain, so too the idea of pain arises in regard to pleasure.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: sdug bsngal chung ngu la sogs @152b pa la bde ba chen po la sogs pa'i blo skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal chung ngu la sogs @152b pa la bde ba chen po la sogs pa'i blo skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The idea of great pleasure arises in regard to slight pain, and so on.

original: sdug bsngal chung ngu bde ba chen po'i blor 'gyur la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal chung ngu bde ba chen po'i blor 'gyur la /

original: 'bring la bde ba 'bring gi blor 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: 'bring la bde ba 'bring gi blor 'gyur zhing /

original: chen po la bde ba chung ngu'i blor 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chen po la bde ba chung ngu'i blor 'gyur ro //
translated: Great pain is the idea of slight pleasure.

original: de ltar na de'i chen po nyid dang chung ngu nyid kyang nyams par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar na de'i chen po nyid dang chung ngu nyid kyang nyams par 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, the idea of great and slight pleasure is also destroyed.

original: de'i phyir ma 'dres kyang chung ngu la sogs pa'i dbye bas so sor rigs rnam pa gsum yod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir ma 'dres kyang chung ngu la sogs pa'i dbye bas so sor rigs rnam pa gsum yod do //
translated: Therefore, even though pleasure is not mixed with pain, it has three varieties, slight and so on, because of the distinction of varieties.

original: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i mjug thogs su bde ba so sor myong ba'i phyir sdug bsngal ma mthong bas gang gi tshe dri dang ro dang reg bya'i khyad par las skyes pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i mjug thogs su bde ba so sor myong ba'i phyir sdug bsngal ma mthong bas gang gi tshe dri dang ro dang reg bya'i khyad par las skyes pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Because one experiences pleasure immediately after neither pleasure nor pain, when one experiences pleasure from the special features of smell, taste, and tactility, at that time there is no pain, because it is weak.üîΩWhen one experiences pain from the special features of smell, taste, and tactility, at that time there is no pleasure, because it is weak.üîΩWhen one experiences neither pleasure nor pain from the special features of smell, taste, and tactility, at that time there is no pleasure or pain, because it is weak.

original: tshor ba 'bring ni bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa la gang gi tshe de'i mjug thogs su dri la sogs pa'i khyad par las skyes pa'i bde ba skye ba de'i tshe ni chung ngu yin pa'i phyir gang la bde ba'i blor 'gyur baüîΩsdug bsngal yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: tshor ba 'bring ni bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa la gang gi tshe de'i mjug thogs su dri la sogs pa'i khyad par las skyes pa'i bde ba skye ba de'i tshe ni chung ngu yin pa'i phyir gang la bde ba'i blor 'gyur ba sdug bsngal yod pa ma yin no //
translated: When one experiences pleasure from the special features of smell, taste, and tactility, at that time there is no pain, because it is weak.üîΩWhen one experiences pain from the special features of smell, taste, and tactility, at that time there is no pleasure, because it is weak.üîΩWhen one experiences neither pleasure nor pain from the special features of smell, taste, and tactility, at that time there is no pleasure or pain, because it is weak.

original: ma skyes pa dang 'gag pa na zhes bya ba ni gal te sdug bsngal chung ngu la bde ba'i blor 'gyur na ni ma skyes pa'i tshe dang / 'gag pa'i tshe bde ba'i blo shin tu tshes skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma skyes pa dang 'gag pa na zhes bya ba ni gal te sdug bsngal chung ngu la bde ba'i blor 'gyur na ni ma skyes pa'i tshe dang / 'gag pa'i tshe bde ba'i blo shin tu tshes skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the idea of pleasure arises in regard to weak pain, then when pain is not yet arisen and when it has ceased, the idea of pleasure should arise, because it is weak.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sdug bsngal ma lus pa dang bral ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ma lus pa dang bral ba'i phyir te /
translated: because it is the removal of all suffering.

original: sngar dang zhig nas med pa'i gnas skabs dag tu'o //
analyzed: sngar dang zhig nas med pa'i gnas skabs dag tu'o //
translated: This is the case when it has not existed previously and when it has been destroyed.

original: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i gnas skabs su sdug bsngal chung ngu ma skyes pa dang / 'gag pa na bde ba'i blo shin tu ches skye ba 'di ni mthong ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i gnas skabs su sdug bsngal chung ngu ma skyes pa dang / 'gag pa na bde ba'i blo shin tu ches skye ba 'di ni mthong ba yang ma yin no //
translated: And when there is a state that is neither pleasant nor unpleasant, there is the arising of the idea of pleasure when a small amount of suffering has not yet arisen or has already ceased, but this is not seen.

original: 'dod pa'i bde ba mngon sum gyur pa la yang de bzhin du brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i bde ba mngon sum gyur pa la yang de bzhin du brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The same should be said about the manifest pleasure of the desire realm.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: 'dod chags kyi sdug bsngal chung ngu la 'dod pa'i bde ba'i blor 'gyur zhes bya bar ro ;
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi sdug bsngal chung ngu la 'dod pa'i bde ba'i blor 'gyur zhes bya bar ro ;
translated: The idea of pleasure in the desire realm arises from a small amount of suffering due to attachment.

original: /'dod chags kyi sdug bsngal chung ngu de ma skyes pa dang / 'gag pa na yang bde ba'i blo shin tu ches skye bar 'gyur na 'di ni mthong ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: /'dod chags kyi sdug bsngal chung ngu de ma skyes pa dang / 'gag pa na yang bde ba'i blo shin tu ches skye bar 'gyur na 'di ni mthong ba yang ma yin no //
translated: And when that small amount of suffering due to attachment has not yet arisen or has already ceased, the idea of pleasure arises very strongly, but this is not seen.

original: tshor ba chung ngu la ni zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal chung ngu la zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: tshor ba chung ngu la ni zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal chung ngu la zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúIn regard to small pain‚Äù means in regard to small suffering.

original: 'bring la ni mi gsal bar zhes bya ba ni bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: 'bring la ni mi gsal bar zhes bya ba ni bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
translated: ‚ÄúIn regard to medium pain‚Äù means in regard to neither pleasure nor suffering, which is characterized as neither pleasure nor pain.

original: bsam gtan gsum na bde ba yod do zhes 'byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dang po dang / gnyis pa dang / gsum pa dag na ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum na bde ba yod do zhes 'byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dang po dang / gnyis pa dang / gsum pa dag na ste /
translated: Because it is said, ‚ÄúThere is pleasure in the third meditative absorption,‚ÄùüîΩit is thought that if pleasure arises in regard to small pain,

original: gal te sdug bsngal chung ngu la ni bde ba'i blor 'gyur na snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: gal te sdug bsngal chung ngu la ni bde ba'i blor 'gyur na snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: then it is pleasure.

original: gong na bde ba yang ma yin sdug @153a * //
analyzed: gong na bde ba yang ma yin sdug @153a * //
translated: Because it is said, ‚ÄúThere is neither pleasure nor pain in the higher realms,‚Äù

original: bsngal yang ma yin pa yod do zhes 'byung bas zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan bzhi pa dang gzugs med pa dag na btang snyoms yod do zhes 'byung bas sdug bsngal 'bring du yang 'gyur na /
analyzed: bsngal yang ma yin pa yod do zhes 'byung bas zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan bzhi pa dang gzugs med pa dag na btang snyoms yod do zhes 'byung bas sdug bsngal 'bring du yang 'gyur na /
translated: it is thought that if there is equanimity in the fourth meditative absorption and the formless realm, then there is medium pain.

original: su zhig sdug bsngal 'bring shes nas de thob par bya ba'i phyir 'og ma'i bsam gtan las 'dod chags dang bral ba la 'bad pa byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: su zhig sdug bsngal 'bring shes nas de thob par bya ba'i phyir 'og ma'i bsam gtan las 'dod chags dang bral ba la 'bad pa byed par 'gyur /
translated: Who would know the medium of suffering and strive to attain it by separating from attachment to the lower meditative stabilization?

original: ming chen gal te zhes bya ba gang gi phyir gzugs de bde ba yang yod /
analyzed: ming chen gal te zhes bya ba gang gi phyir gzugs de bde ba yang yod /
translated: Mahakacyapa, because form is pleasant,

original: bde ba dang rjes su 'brel pa yod /
analyzed: bde ba dang rjes su 'brel pa yod /
translated: it is related to pleasure,üîΩit is related to mental satisfaction,

original: yid bde ba dang rjes su 'brel pa yang yod pa de'i phyir gzugs kyang 'di lta ste /üîΩkun du 'dod chags pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: yid bde ba dang rjes su 'brel pa yang yod pa de'i phyir gzugs kyang 'di lta ste / kun du 'dod chags pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du 'byung ba yin no //

original: gal te bde ba'i rgyu rnam par mi gnas pa'i phyir bde ba med na /
analyzed: gal te bde ba'i rgyu rnam par mi gnas pa'i phyir bde ba med na /
translated: If pleasure does not exist because the causes of pleasure are not ascertained,

analyzed: de ltar na ni 'o na sdug bsngal gyi rgyu rnams kyang rnam par mi gnas pas sdug bsngal yang med par 'gyur ro //
translated: then suffering also would not exist because the causes of suffering are not ascertained.

original: ji ltar bde ba'i rgyu rnam par mi gnas pa de bzhin du sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yang yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar bde ba'i rgyu rnam par mi gnas pa de bzhin du sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yang yin te /
translated: Just as the causes of pleasure are not ascertained, so the causes of suffering are not ascertained.

original: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu rnam par mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu rnam par mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the cause of suffering is not present.

original: yul 'ba' zhig ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni yul tsam las bde ba skye bar ni khas mi len gyi /
analyzed: yul 'ba' zhig ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni yul tsam las bde ba skye bar ni khas mi len gyi /
translated: It is not the case that the object alone is the cause of pleasure.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is the cause of pleasure?

original: lus 'gyur ba'i khyad par la ltos pa'i yul bde ba'i rgyu 'am sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin gyi yul 'ba' zhig ni ma yin no //
analyzed: lus 'gyur ba'i khyad par la ltos pa'i yul bde ba'i rgyu 'am sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin gyi yul 'ba' zhig ni ma yin no //
translated: The cause of pleasure is an object that is related to a special transformation of the body, or the cause of suffering is an object that is related to a special transformation of the body. It is not the case that the object alone is the cause of pleasure or the cause of suffering.

original: 'di ltar dro ba'i reg pa rten gyi 'byung ba'i gnas skabs gang phrad nas bde ba'i rgyu yin pa ni de nyid dang phrad nas yang rgyu ma yin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar dro ba'i reg pa rten gyi 'byung ba'i gnas skabs gang phrad nas bde ba'i rgyu yin pa ni de nyid dang phrad nas yang rgyu ma yin pa ma yin te /
translated: For example, a contact that is warm is the cause of pleasure when it is related to a particular condition of the primary elements that are the basis of contact. It is not the case that it is not the cause of pleasure when it is related to that very condition of the primary elements.

original: gzhan la yang de bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
